title: Hai Yang Shi You 981 standoff
input: The Hai Yang Shi You 981 standoff, also known as the 2014 China-Vietnam oil rig crisis, refers to the tensions between China and Vietnam arising from the Chinese state-owned China National Offshore Oil Corporation moving its Hai Yang Shi You 981 (known in Vietnam as "Hải Dương - 981") oil platform to waters near the disputed Paracel Islands in South China Sea, and the resulting Vietnamese efforts to prevent the platform from establishing a fixed position. According to an announcement by the Hainan Maritime Safety Administration of China, the drilling work of the Hai Yang Shi You 981 would last from May 2 to August 15, 2014. On July 15, China announced that the platform had completed its work and withdrew it fully one month earlier than originally
paraphrase: The 2014 China-Vietnam oil rig crisis, also known as the Hai Yang Shi You 981 standoff, occurred when China's state-owned China National Offshore Oil Corporation moved its oil platform, known as "Hải Dương - 981" in Vietnam, to disputed waters near the Paracel Islands in the South China Sea. This caused tensions between China and Vietnam, as the latter attempted to prevent the platform from establishing a fixed position. The Hainan Maritime Safety Administration of China announced that the drilling work of the Hai Yang Shi You 981 would take place from May 2 to August 15, 2014. However, China withdrew the platform on July 15, one month earlier than originally planned.

title: Dark Angel (band)
input: Dark Angel is an American thrash metal band from Downey, California, that formed in 1981. The band's current lineup includes drummer Gene Hoglan, guitarists Eric Meyer and Laura Christine, frontman Ron Rinehart and bassist Mike Gonzalez. In its history, they have gone through many lineup changes, and as of guitarist Jim Durkin's death in March 2023, there are no original members left in the current lineup of Dark Angel. Meyer, who joined in 1984, is the only member to appear on all of their albums. Dark Angel's over-the-top style (extremely fast, heavy and lengthy songs with many tempo changes, lyrics, and extended instrumental parts) earned them the nickname "The L.A. Caffeine Machine". Despite never achieving mainstream success, the band is often credited as one of the leaders of
paraphrase:
the thrash metal genre in America. 

Dark Angel, a thrash metal band hailing from Downey, California, was established in 1981. The current members of the band include Gene Hoglan on drums, Eric Meyer and Laura Christine on guitars, Ron Rinehart as the frontman, and Mike Gonzalez on bass. Over the years, the band has undergone several changes in its lineup, and with the passing of guitarist Jim Durkin in March 2023, there are no original members left in the current lineup. Meyer, who joined the band in 1984, is the only member to have contributed to all of their albums. The band's music is characterized by its fast, heavy, and lengthy songs with numerous tempo changes, lyrics, and extended instrumental parts, earning them the nickname "The L.A. Caffeine Machine." Despite not achieving mainstream success, Dark Angel is often recognized as one of the pioneers of the thrash metal genre in America.

title: Patagotitan
input: Patagotitan is a genus of titanosaurian sauropod dinosaur from the Cerro Barcino Formation in Chubut Province, Patagonia, Argentina. The genus contains a single species known from at least six young adult individuals, Patagotitan mayorum, which was first announced in 2014 and then validly named in 2017 by José Carballido and colleagues. Preliminary studies and press releases suggested that Patagotitan was the largest known titanosaur and land animal overall, with an estimated length of 37 m (121 ft) and an estimated weight of 69 tonnes (76 short tons). Later research revised the length estimate down to 31 m (102 ft) and weight estimates down to approximately 50–57 tonnes (55–63 short tons), suggesting that Patagotitan was of a similar size to, if not smaller than, its closest relatives Argentinosaurus and
paraphrase: Patagotitan is a type of sauropod dinosaur that belongs to the titanosaurian family. It was discovered in the Cerro Barcino Formation in Chubut Province, Patagonia, Argentina and is made up of only one species, Patagotitan mayorum. This species is known to have at least six young adult individuals. The announcement of Patagotitan mayorum was made in 2014 and it was officially named in 2017 by José Carballido and colleagues. Early studies and press releases suggested that Patagotitan was the largest known land animal and titanosaur, with an estimated length of 37 m (121 ft) and weight of 69 tonnes (76 short tons). However, later research revised these estimates to a length of 31 m (102 ft) and weight of approximately 50-57 tonnes (55-63 short tons). This suggests that Patagotitan was similar in size, if not smaller, than its closest relatives, Argentinosaurus and Notocolossus.

title: Art Buff
input: Art Buff is a graffiti artwork by Banksy which was created in Folkestone in 2014, Banksy announcing it as "part of the Folkestone triennial. Kind of". The work depicts a woman wearing headphones and staring at a plinth, upon which rests a patch of painted-out graffiti. The name of the piece is a play on words, "buff" being a slang term for the painting over of graffiti.Reported on 13 October 2014, Art Buff was vandalized with the spray painting of a penis sitting on top of the plinth.During early November 2014 Robin Barton and Bankrobber London organized the removal of Art Buff from its Folkestone location following requests from the owners of the wall, and announced plans to put it up for sale in aid of a cancer
paraphrase: Art Buff is a piece of graffiti art created by Banksy in Folkestone in 2014. Banksy referred to it as "part of the Folkestone triennial. Kind of." The artwork features a woman wearing headphones and looking at a plinth with a painted-out graffiti patch. The title of the piece is a wordplay on "buff," which means to paint over graffiti. On October 13, 2014, Art Buff was defaced with a spray-painted penis on the plinth. In early November 2014, Robin Barton and Bankrobber London removed the artwork from its location in Folkestone at the request of the wall owners. They announced plans to sell it to raise funds for cancer.

title: War of 1812 Monument
input: The War of 1812 Monument, officially titled Triumph Through Diversity (Triomphe grâce à la diversité in French), is a bronze and stone memorial, located at Parliament Hill in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, Canada's capital. Seven figures—a First Nations fighter, a Métis militiaman, a regular infantryman from the Royal Newfoundland Regiment of Fencible Infantry, a Quebec soldier of the Canadian Voltigeurs being bandaged by a female figure, a Royal Navy marine, and a farmer—represent those who took part on the Canadian side of the War of 1812. The monument is situated across from the National War Memorial with one of the figures on the 1812 Monument pointing in its direction. Also part of the monument is a maple tree planted in soil taken from 10 Canadian battlefield sites and watered
paraphrase: The Triumph Through Diversity, also known as the War of 1812 Monument, is a memorial made of bronze and stone located in Ottawa, Canada's capital, on Parliament Hill. It features seven figures, including a First Nations fighter, a Métis militiaman, a regular infantryman from the Royal Newfoundland Regiment of Fencible Infantry, a Quebec soldier of the Canadian Voltigeurs being tended to by a female figure, a Royal Navy marine, and a farmer, all representing those who fought on the Canadian side of the War of 1812. The monument is positioned across from the National War Memorial, with one of the figures pointing towards it. Additionally, the monument includes a maple tree planted in soil taken from 10 Canadian battlefield sites and watered.

title: Battle of Shuja'iyya
input: The Battle of Shuja'iyya occurred between the Israel Defense Forces and the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades on 20 July 2014 during 2014 Israel–Gaza conflict in the Shuja'iyya neighborhood of Gaza City, in the Gaza Strip.: 71 Shuja'iyya, with 92,000 people in 6 sq-kilometres, is one of the most densely populated areas of the Gaza Strip. According to the IDF, it had become a "terrorist fortress", that between 8 and 20 July had fired over 140 rockets into Israel after the outbreak of hostilities. Casualty figures are not known with precision, partly because bodies were recovered long after the fighting, and people had also died of injuries afterwards. The UN Protection Cluster states that between the 19-20th, 55 civilians, including 19 children and 14 women, were killed as a
paraphrase: result of the Battle of Shuja'iyya, which took place on 20 July 2014 during the Israel-Gaza conflict. This battle involved the Israel Defense Forces and the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades in the densely populated Shuja'iyya neighborhood of Gaza City. The IDF claimed that this area had become a "terrorist fortress" and had fired over 140 rockets into Israel between 8 and 20 July. The exact number of casualties is uncertain due to the delayed recovery of bodies and deaths from injuries sustained during the fighting. According to the UN Protection Cluster, 55 civilians, including 19 children and 14 women, were killed during the 19-20th of July.

title: 2014 Toronto Rock season
input: The Toronto Rock are a lacrosse team based in Toronto playing in the National Lacrosse League (NLL). The 2014 season was the 17th in franchise history, and 16th as the Rock. After an up-and-down start to the season, the Rock acquired goaltender Brandon Miller from the Philadelphia Wings at the trade deadline hoping to revitalize their shaky defense. On April 5, star forward Garrett Billings tore his ACL during a game against the Vancouver Stealth and was lost for the remainder of the season. Despite losing the league's scoring leader, the Rock won that game, which started a four-game winning streak to finish the regular season and clinch second place in the Eastern division ahead of the slumping Buffalo Bandits. But the Bandits ended their 8-game losing streak
paraphrase: by defeating the Rock in the first round of the playoffs, ending Toronto's season. The Toronto Rock is a lacrosse team that plays in the National Lacrosse League (NLL) and is based in Toronto. They have been in existence for 17 seasons, with 16 of those seasons being played under the name "Rock". At the start of the 2014 season, the team had some difficulties, but they acquired Brandon Miller as their goaltender from the Philadelphia Wings in hopes of improving their defense. During a game against the Vancouver Stealth, Garrett Billings, one of the team's star forwards, suffered an ACL injury and was unable to play for the rest of the season. Despite this setback, the Rock managed to win the game and went on to win four more games in a row, securing second place in the Eastern division. However, their winning streak was ended by the Buffalo Bandits, who defeated them in the playoffs and ended their season.

title: 2023 U-17 Africa Cup of Nations
input: The 2023 U-17 Africa Cup of Nations known as 2023 U17 AFCON for short and/or the TotalEnergies U-17 Africa Cup of Nations for sponsorship purposes is the 15th edition (20th if editions of the tournament without hosts are included) of the biennial international youth football tournament organized by the Confederation of African Football (CAF) its male national teams consisting of players aged 17 and below. In May 2021, it was decided that the tournament would be hosted by Algeria. This would have been the second edition of the tournament to have expanded to twelve teams instead of eight. The top four teams of the tournament will qualify for the 2023 FIFA U-17 World Cup as the CAF representatives. Cameroon are the defending champions, having won the 2019 edition
paraphrase: The 2023 U-17 Africa Cup of Nations, also referred to as the 2023 U17 AFCON or the TotalEnergies U-17 Africa Cup of Nations due to sponsorship, is the 15th edition (or 20th if editions without hosts are included) of the international youth football tournament organized by the Confederation of African Football (CAF) for male national teams with players aged 17 and under. Algeria was chosen to host the tournament in May 2021, which would have been the second edition to feature twelve teams instead of eight. The top four teams will qualify for the 2023 FIFA U-17 World Cup as CAF representatives. Cameroon won the 2019 edition and are the current champions.

title: Rebellion (2023)
input: The 2023 Rebellion was a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event produced by Impact Wrestling. It took place on April 16, 2023, at the Rebel Entertainment Complex in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It was the fifth event under the Rebellion chronology. Ten matches were contested at the event, including two on the pre-show and one taped as a digital exclusive. In the main event, Deonna Purrazzo defeated Jordynne Grace to win the vacant Impact Knockouts World Championship. In other prominent matches, Steve Maclin defeated Kushida to win the vacant Impact World Championship, Trey Miguel defeated Jonathan Gresham and Mike Bailey to retain for the Impact X Division Championship, and Team Dreamer (Tommy Dreamer, Bhupinder Gujjar, Frankie Kazarian, Killer Kelly, and Yuya Uemura) defeated Team Bully (Bully Ray, Brian Myers, Kenny
paraphrase: The 2023 Rebellion was a wrestling event that was broadcasted on pay-per-view by Impact Wrestling. It was held on April 16, 2023, at the Rebel Entertainment Complex in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, and was the fifth event in the Rebellion series. The event featured ten matches, with two taking place during the pre-show and one being recorded as a digital exclusive. Deonna Purrazzo won the Impact Knockouts World Championship in the main event by defeating Jordynne Grace. Other notable matches included Steve Maclin winning the vacant Impact World Championship by defeating Kushida, Trey Miguel retaining the Impact X Division Championship by defeating Jonathan Gresham and Mike Bailey, and Team Dreamer (Tommy Dreamer, Bhupinder Gujjar, Frankie Kazarian, Killer Kelly, and Yuya Uemura) defeating Team Bully (Bully Ray, Brian Myers, Kenny King, Laredo Kid, and TJP).

title: Fit for 55
input: Fit for 55 is a package by the European Union designed to reduce the European Union's greenhouse gas emissions by 55% by 2030. The package was proposed in July 2021 by the European Commission. Under an accelerated legislative process, the plans may become law in 2022. Measures include additional support for clean transport, renewables, and a tariff called the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism on emissions for high-carbon imports from countries lacking sufficient greenhouse gas reduction measures of their own. It proposes to extend the European Union Emissions Trading System to transport and heat. Compared to the net-zero scenario from the International Energy Agency, the plan contains more measures to ensure that energy remains affordable. The environmental organization Greenpeace criticized the package for not being suitable for halting global
paraphrase: The Fit for 55 initiative is a European Union package that aims to decrease the region's greenhouse gas emissions by 55% by 2030. The European Commission proposed the package in July 2021, and it may become law in 2022 through an accelerated legislative process. The package includes various measures, such as increased support for clean transportation and renewable energy, as well as a tariff called the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism on high-carbon imports from countries without adequate greenhouse gas reduction measures. The initiative also proposes to expand the European Union Emissions Trading System to include transportation and heating. Compared to the International Energy Agency's net-zero scenario, the Fit for 55 plan includes more measures to ensure energy affordability. However, Greenpeace criticized the package for not being sufficient to stop global warming.

title: 2022 Uganda Ebola outbreak
input: The 2022 Uganda Ebola outbreak was an outbreak of the Sudan ebolavirus, which causes Ebola, from 20 September 2022 until 10 January 2023 in the Western and Central Regions of Uganda. Over 160 people were infected, including 77 people who died. It was Uganda's fifth outbreak with Sudan ebolavirus. The Ugandan Ministry of Health declared the outbreak on 20 September 2022. As of 25 October 2022, there were confirmed cases in the Mubende, Kyegegwa, Kassanda, Kagadi, Bunyanga, Kampala and Wakiso districts. As of 24 October 2022, there were a total of 90 confirmed or probable cases and 44 deaths. On 12 October, the first recorded death in the capital of Kampala occurred; 12 days later on 24 October, there had been a total of 14 infections in the
paraphrase: The Sudan ebolavirus caused an outbreak of Ebola in Uganda from September 20, 2022, to January 10, 2023, affecting the Western and Central Regions. The outbreak resulted in over 160 infections, with 77 fatalities, marking the fifth occurrence of Sudan ebolavirus in Uganda. The Ministry of Health declared the outbreak on September 20, 2022, and confirmed cases were reported in several districts, including Mubende, Kyegegwa, Kassanda, Kagadi, Bunyanga, Kampala, and Wakiso. As of October 24, 2022, there were 90 confirmed or probable cases and 44 deaths. The first death in Kampala was recorded on October 12, and by October 24, there were 14 infections in the capital.

title: AEW All In (2023)
input: The 2023 All In, also known as All in London at Wembley Stadium, is the upcoming second All In professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event. It will be the first edition of the event to be produced by All Elite Wrestling (AEW) after the inaugural All In was held independently in September 2018, a few months prior to AEW's formation in January 2019. The event will take place on August 27, 2023, at Wembley Stadium in London, England. This will mark AEW's debut in the United Kingdom, their first PPV event held outside of North America, and the company's first event to be held entirely in a soccer stadium. This also marks the first professional wrestling event to be held at present day Wembley Stadium, with AEW promoting the
paraphrase: The upcoming second All In professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event, also known as All in London at Wembley Stadium, is set to take place on August 27, 2023. This event will be produced by All Elite Wrestling (AEW), marking their debut in the United Kingdom and their first PPV event held outside of North America. The inaugural All In event was held independently in September 2018, a few months prior to AEW's formation in January 2019. This event will also be the first professional wrestling event to be held at present day Wembley Stadium, and the first event to be held entirely in a soccer stadium. AEW is promoting this event.

title: 2014 American immigration crisis
input: The 2014 American immigration crisis was a surge in unaccompanied children and women from the Northern Triangle of Central America (NTCA) seeking entrance to the United States in 2014. According to U.S. law, an unaccompanied alien child refers to a person under 18 years of age, who has no lawful immigration status in the U.S., and who does not have a legal guardian to provide physical custody and care.Between 2013 and 2014, the number of unaccompanied children apprehended at the border increased nearly 80%, from 38,759 in fiscal year 2013 to 68,541 in fiscal year 2014. This influx in unaccompanied minor children has been attributed to a number of factors including the high rates of gang-related violent crime in the Northern Triangle; the promulgation of false "permiso" rumors

As per U.S. law, an unaccompanied alien child is defined as a person under 18 years of age who lacks lawful immigration status in the U.S. and does not have a legal guardian to provide physical custody and care. The number of unaccompanied children apprehended at the border rose by almost 80% between 2013 and 2014, from 38,759 to 68,541. This rise in unaccompanied minors was due to various factors, including high levels of gang-related violent crime in the Northern Triangle and the spread of false "permiso" rumors.

title: Lucha Libre World Cup (2023)
input: The Lucha Libre World Cup was a professional wrestling event and tournament organized by Mexican professional wrestling promotion Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide (AAA). The tournament took place on March 19, 2023 at Estadio de Béisbol Charros de Jalisco in Zapopan, near Guadalajara, Mexico. The 2023 edition of the tournament featured three-person teams, referred to as trios in Lucha Libre; this differed from the previous edition of the event which featured traditional two-person tag teams. The tournament showcased teams with wrestlers from numerous international promotions including Mexico's Nación Lucha Libre (NLL), America's All Elite Wrestling (AEW), Impact Wrestling (Impact), and the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA), Japan's Dragon Gate and Oz Academy (Oz), and Qatar Pro Wrestling (QPW). The men's tournament was won by Team Mexico (Taurus, Pentagón Jr., and

Fénix) while the women's tournament was won by Team Japan (Mayu Iwatani, Momo Watanabe, and Utami Hayashishita).

title: Hurricane Ana
input: Hurricane Ana was the second tropical cyclone in 2014 to threaten the U.S. state of Hawaii with a direct hit, after Iselle in August. The twenty-first named storm and fifteenth hurricane of the 2014 Pacific hurricane season, Ana formed from a disturbance that formed in the Central Pacific in mid-October. It rapidly consolidated, and a tropical depression developed by October 13. Aided by favorable conditions, Ana gradually strengthened while moving westward, threatening to pass over the island chain of Hawaii once or several times as indicated by early forecasts. By October 17, it had strengthened to a hurricane south of Hawaii and reached its peak intensity shortly afterwards while also making its closest approach. Afterwards, Ana weakened and began to fluctuate in intensity as it turned to the
paraphrase: In 2014, Hurricane Ana posed a direct threat to Hawaii, making it the second tropical cyclone to do so after Iselle in August. It was the twenty-first named storm and fifteenth hurricane of the Pacific hurricane season that year. Ana originated from a disturbance in the Central Pacific in mid-October and quickly consolidated, resulting in the formation of a tropical depression by October 13. With favorable conditions, Ana gradually gained strength while moving westward, and early forecasts indicated that it could pass over Hawaii once or multiple times. By October 17, Ana had become a hurricane south of Hawaii and reached its peak intensity shortly after its closest approach. Subsequently, Ana weakened and began to fluctuate in intensity as it turned.

title: 2013–2014 Thai political crisis
input: The 2013–2014 Thai political crisis was a period of political instability in Thailand. Anti-government protests took place between November 2013 and May 2014, organised by the People's Democratic Reform Committee (PDRC), a political pressure group led by former Democrat Party parliamentary representative (MP) Suthep Thaugsuban. The crisis eventually resulted in the removal of incumbent Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, a coup d'état, and the establishment of a military junta. The primary aim of the protests was the removal of former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra's – the brother of Yingluck – influence on Thai politics and the creation of an unelected "people's council" to oversee reforms of the political system. Protesters viewed Thaksin as corrupt and damaging to Thailand's democracy, although he enjoyed strong support in many areas of Thailand,
paraphrase: The period of political instability in Thailand from 2013 to 2014 was marked by anti-government protests organized by the People's Democratic Reform Committee (PDRC), led by former Democrat Party MP Suthep Thaugsuban. The protests aimed to remove former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra's influence on Thai politics and establish an unelected "people's council" to oversee political reforms. Protesters believed Thaksin was corrupt and harmful to Thailand's democracy, despite his popularity in some regions. The crisis resulted in the removal of Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, a coup d'état, and the establishment of a military junta.

title: Whaling in the Antarctic case
input: Japanese whaling, in terms of active hunting of whales, is estimated by the Japan Whaling Association to have begun around the 12th century. However, Japanese whaling on an industrial scale began around the 1890s when Japan started to participate in the modern whaling industry, at that time an industry in which many countries participated. Japan resumed commercial whaling in July 2019, and since then whaling activities have been confined to its territorial waters and exclusive economic zone.During the 20th century, Japan was heavily involved in commercial whaling. This continued until the International Whaling Commission (IWC) moratorium on commercial whaling went into effect in 1986. Japan continued to hunt whales using the scientific research provision in the agreement and Japanese whaling was conducted by the Institute of Cetacean Research.
paraphrase: The Japan Whaling Association believes that Japanese whaling, which involves actively hunting whales, began in the 12th century. However, it wasn't until the 1890s that Japan began participating in the modern whaling industry, which was a global industry at the time. In July 2019, Japan resumed commercial whaling, but only within its territorial waters and exclusive economic zone. Throughout the 20th century, Japan was heavily involved in commercial whaling until the International Whaling Commission (IWC) imposed a moratorium on it in 1986. Despite this, Japan continued to hunt whales under the guise of scientific research, which was conducted by the Institute of Cetacean Research.

title: Palestinian tunnel warfare in the Gaza Strip
input: Hamas, the governing authority in the Gaza Strip, has constructed a sophisticated network of military tunnels since it seized control of the Strip in 2007. The tunnel system branches beneath many Gazan towns and cities, such as Khan Yunis, Jabalia and the Shati refugee camp. The internal tunnels, running some dozens of kilometres within the Gaza Strip, have several functions. Hamas uses the tunnels to hide its arsenal of rocketry underground, to facilitate communication, to permit munition stocks to be hidden, and to conceal militants, making detection from the air difficult. Hamas leader Khalid Meshal said in an interview with Vanity Fair that the tunnel system is a defensive structure, designed to place obstacles against Israel's powerful military arsenal and engage in counter-strikes behind the lines of the
paraphrase: Hamas, the ruling authority in Gaza, has developed an advanced network of military tunnels since taking control of the area in 2007. These tunnels are located beneath various towns and cities in Gaza, including Khan Yunis, Jabalia, and the Shati refugee camp. The tunnels, which span several kilometers within Gaza, serve multiple purposes. Hamas uses them to conceal their rocket arsenal, facilitate communication, hide ammunition, and make it difficult for militants to be detected from the air. According to Hamas leader Khalid Meshal, the tunnel system is a defensive structure intended to hinder Israel's powerful military and enable counter-attacks from behind enemy lines.

title: Russian invasion of Ukraine
input: On 24 February 2022, Russia invaded and occupied parts of Ukraine in a major escalation of the Russo-Ukrainian War, which had begun in 2014. The invasion has resulted in tens of thousands of deaths on both sides, and instigated Europe's largest refugee crisis since World War II. About 8 million Ukrainians were displaced within their country by June, and more than 8.1 million had fled the country by March 2023. For months before the invasion, Russian troops massed around Ukraine's borders while Russian officials repeatedly denied plans to attack Ukraine. On 24 February 2022, Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a "special military operation" to support the Russian-controlled breakaway republics of Donetsk and Luhansk, whose military forces had been fighting Ukraine in the Donbas conflict. He said the goal
paraphrase: In February 2022, Russia launched a major attack on Ukraine, occupying parts of the country and escalating the ongoing Russo-Ukrainian War that began in 2014. The conflict has resulted in a significant number of casualties on both sides and has caused the largest refugee crisis in Europe since World War II, with millions of Ukrainians displaced within their country or fleeing to other nations. Prior to the invasion, Russian troops had been gathering near Ukraine's borders, despite repeated denials from Russian officials about any plans to attack. Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a "special military operation" to support the breakaway republics of Donetsk and Luhansk, which had been fighting Ukraine in the Donbas conflict. The objective of the operation was to aid these Russian-controlled regions.

title: 2022–2023 United Kingdom industrial disputes and strikes
input: Since May–June 2022, a series of labour strikes and industrial disputes have occurred in various industries of the United Kingdom's economy as workers walked out over pay and conditions. The strikes took place with rising inflation, and demands for pay increases that would keep pace with this inflation. The strikes began on 15 June 2022 after members of the National Union of Rail, Maritime and Transport Workers (RMT) voted to strike over planned changes to their pay and working conditions. They were soon joined by other railway unions, and a series of one-day strikes halted trains in many parts of the British mainland. Train services operated at 20% of normal capacity on strike days. Public support for the strikes was organised through the Enough is Enough! campaign. With
paraphrase: Starting from May-June 2022, there have been a number of labor strikes and industrial disputes across various industries in the UK. These strikes were initiated by workers who were dissatisfied with their pay and working conditions, particularly in light of the rising inflation. The first strike occurred on June 15, 2022, when members of the National Union of Rail, Maritime and Transport Workers (RMT) voted to strike against proposed changes to their pay and working conditions. Other railway unions soon joined in, resulting in a series of one-day strikes that disrupted train services across the country. On strike days, train services operated at only 20% of their normal capacity. The Enough is Enough! campaign was organized to garner public support for the strikes.

title: Second Thomas Shoal laser incident
input: On February 6, 2023, the China Coast Guard and Philippine Coast Guard had an encounter near the Second Thomas Shoal, one of the features of the Spratly Islands which is subject to a wider dispute in the South China Sea. The Second Thomas Shoal is claimed by multiple countries, including China and the Philippines. The latter controls the feature by having grounded the BRP Sierra Madre on the shoal. The BRP Malapascua of the Philippine Coast Guard was heading towards the shoal for a rotation and rotation and resupply mission for the BRP Sierra Madre crew when CCG 5205 of the China Coast Guard blocked the Filipino coast guard ship to act what it views as an intrusion of the Philippine vessel and aimed a green laser light
paraphrase: On February 6, 2023, there was a confrontation between the China Coast Guard and the Philippine Coast Guard near the Second Thomas Shoal, which is part of the Spratly Islands and is the subject of a larger dispute in the South China Sea. The Second Thomas Shoal is claimed by several countries, including China and the Philippines. The Philippines currently controls the feature by having grounded the BRP Sierra Madre on the shoal. The Philippine Coast Guard's BRP Malapascua was on its way to the shoal to rotate and resupply the crew of the BRP Sierra Madre when the China Coast Guard's CCG 5205 blocked the Filipino vessel, claiming it was intruding, and shone a green laser light.

title: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17
input: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 (MH17/MAS17) was a scheduled passenger flight from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur that was shot down by Russian-controlled forces on 17 July 2014, while flying over eastern Ukraine. All 283 passengers and 15 crew were killed. Contact with the aircraft, a Boeing 777-200ER, was lost when it was about 50 km (31 mi) from the Ukraine–Russia border, and wreckage from the aircraft fell near Hrabove in Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine, 40 km (25 mi) from the border. The shoot-down occurred during the war in Donbas over territory controlled by Russian separatist forces.The responsibility for investigation was delegated to the Dutch Safety Board (DSB) and the Dutch-led joint investigation team (JIT), who in 2016 reported that the airliner had been downed by a Buk surface-to-air missile launched
paraphrase: On 17 July 2014, Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 (MH17/MAS17) was flying from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur when it was shot down by Russian-controlled forces over eastern Ukraine. The Boeing 777-200ER was carrying 283 passengers and 15 crew members, all of whom died. The plane lost contact when it was approximately 50 km (31 mi) from the Ukraine-Russia border, and the wreckage fell near Hrabove in Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine, 40 km (25 mi) from the border. The incident occurred during the war in Donbas, in an area controlled by Russian separatist forces. The Dutch Safety Board (DSB) and the Dutch-led joint investigation team (JIT) were tasked with investigating the incident, and in 2016, they concluded that the plane had been brought down by a Buk surface-to-air missile.

title: 2014 UEC European Track Championships
input: The 2014 UEC European Track Championships was the fifth edition of the elite UEC European Track Championships in track cycling and took place at the Vélodrome Amédée Détraux in Baie-Mahault, Guadeloupe, France, between 16 and 19 October. The Event was organised by the European Cycling Union. All European champions are awarded the UEC European Champion jersey which may be worn by the champion throughout the year when competing in the same event at other competitions. The programme for the 2014 championships was considerably extended, and all World Championship track events were held; ten Olympic events, (sprint, team sprint, keirin, team pursuit and omnium, for both men and women), for which qualification points for the 2016 Summer Olympics were available for the first time, and nine non-Olympic events; the
paraphrase: The 2014 UEC European Track Championships, which is the fifth edition of the prestigious UEC European Track Championships in track cycling, was held at the Vélodrome Amédée Détraux in Baie-Mahault, Guadeloupe, France from 16 to 19 October. The European Cycling Union was responsible for organizing the event. The UEC European Champion jersey is awarded to all European champions, and the champion can wear it throughout the year when competing in the same event at other competitions. The 2014 championships had an expanded program, including all World Championship track events, ten Olympic events (sprint, team sprint, keirin, team pursuit, and omnium for both men and women), which offered qualification points for the 2016 Summer Olympics for the first time, and nine non-Olympic events.

title: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370
input: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370) was an international passenger flight operated by Malaysia Airlines that disappeared on 8 March 2014 while flying from Kuala Lumpur International Airport in Malaysia to its planned destination, Beijing Capital International Airport in China. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, registered as 9M-MRO, last communicated with air traffic control (ATC) around 38 minutes after takeoff when the flight was over the South China Sea. The aircraft was lost from ATC’s secondary surveillance radar screens minutes later, but was tracked by the Malaysian military’s primary radar system for another hour, deviating westward from its planned flight path, crossing the Malay Peninsula and Andaman Sea. It left radar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) northwest of Penang Island in northwestern Peninsular Malaysia. With
paraphrase: On 8 March 2014, Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370), an international passenger flight operated by Malaysia Airlines, disappeared while en route from Kuala Lumpur International Airport in Malaysia to Beijing Capital International Airport in China. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, registered as 9M-MRO, last communicated with air traffic control (ATC) approximately 38 minutes after takeoff over the South China Sea. The aircraft disappeared from ATC's secondary surveillance radar screens shortly thereafter, but was tracked by the Malaysian military's primary radar system for an additional hour, deviating from its intended flight path and crossing the Malay Peninsula and Andaman Sea. The aircraft left radar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) northwest of Penang Island in northwestern Peninsular Malaysia.

title: Operation Full Disclosure
input: Operation Full Disclosure (Hebrew: מבצע חשיפה מלאה) was a military operation carried out by the Israel Defense Forces on March 5, 2014, in the Red Sea. After days of surveillance far out to sea, Israeli Navy Shayetet 13 commandos seized the Iranian-owned and Panamanian-registered merchant vessel Klos C that had set sail from Iran, heading for Port Sudan via Iraq. On board, the commandos found long-range missiles suspected to be destined for the Gaza Strip concealed in containers full of Iranian bags marked as Portland cement. An unnamed senior Egyptian security official reportedly confirmed that the arms shipment was headed for militants in either Gaza or Sinai. A UN panel of experts concluded that the weapons came from Iran and were being sent to Sudan, accusing Iran of
paraphrase: Operation Full Disclosure, also known as מבצע חשיפה מלאה in Hebrew, was a military mission conducted by the Israel Defense Forces on March 5, 2014, in the Red Sea. The operation involved the Israeli Navy Shayetet 13 commandos who had been monitoring the area for several days. They successfully captured the Klos C, a merchant vessel owned by Iran and registered in Panama, which was en route to Port Sudan via Iraq. Upon inspection, the commandos discovered long-range missiles that were believed to be intended for the Gaza Strip. The missiles were hidden in containers that were labeled as Portland cement and marked as Iranian bags. According to an unnamed senior Egyptian security official, the weapons were destined for militants in either Gaza or Sinai. A UN panel of experts confirmed that the weapons were of Iranian origin and were being sent to Sudan, accusing Iran of involvement.

title: High Seas Treaty
input: The United Nations High Seas Treaty is an instrument of the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea (UNCLOS), agreed by an intergovernmental conference at the UN on 4 March 2023. Its full formal title is Agreement under the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea on the conservation and sustainable use of marine biological diversity of areas beyond national jurisdiction and is also known as the Biodiversity Beyond National Jurisdiction treaty.It has four main objectives: The establishment of marine protected areas to protect marine biodiversity. The regulation of commercialization of marine genetic resources, which can be used for the development of pharmaceuticals, in order to equitably share their benefits. The equitable access to research conducted in international waters. The setting of global standards
paraphrase: The United Nations High Seas Treaty, also known as the Biodiversity Beyond National Jurisdiction treaty, was created as part of the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea (UNCLOS) and was agreed upon by an intergovernmental conference on March 4, 2023. Its primary purpose is to promote the conservation and sustainable use of marine biological diversity in areas beyond national jurisdiction. The treaty has four main objectives, which include the establishment of marine protected areas, regulation of commercialization of marine genetic resources, equitable access to research conducted in international waters, and the setting of global standards.

title: José Salvador Alvarenga
input: José Salvador Alvarenga (Spanish: [xoˈse salβaˈðoɾ alβaˈɾeŋɡa]; born c. 1975) is a Salvadoran fisherman and author who was found on January 30, 2014, aged 36 or 37, on the Marshall Islands after spending 14 months adrift in a fishing boat in the Pacific Ocean beginning on November 17, 2012. He survived mainly on a diet of raw fish, turtles, small birds, sharks and rainwater. He swam to shore at Tile Islet, a small island that is part of Ebon Atoll, on January 30. Two locals, Emi Libokmeto and Russel Laikidrik, found him naked, clutching a knife and shouting in Spanish. He was treated in a hospital in Majuro before flying to his family home in El Salvador on February 10.Alvarenga's story was heavily reported worldwide despite initial criticism
paraphrase: José Salvador Alvarenga, a fisherman and writer from El Salvador, was discovered on January 30, 2014, at the Marshall Islands after being lost at sea for 14 months in a fishing boat in the Pacific Ocean. He was around 36 or 37 years old at the time. Alvarenga survived by consuming raw fish, turtles, small birds, sharks, and rainwater. He arrived at Tile Islet, a small island that is part of Ebon Atoll, on January 30, and was discovered by two locals, Emi Libokmeto and Russel Laikidrik, who found him naked, holding a knife, and shouting in Spanish. He was treated at a hospital in Majuro before returning to his family home in El Salvador on February 10. Despite initial criticism, Alvarenga's story was widely reported worldwide.

title: 4th Magritte Awards
input: The 4th Magritte Awards ceremony, presented by the Académie André Delvaux, honored the best films of 2013 in Belgium and took place on 1 February 2014, at the Square in the historic site of Mont des Arts, Brussels beginning at 8:00 p.m. CET. During the ceremony, the Académie André Delvaux presented Magritte Awards in 21 categories. The ceremony was televised in Belgium by BeTV. Actress Émilie Dequenne presided the ceremony, while actor Fabrizio Rongione hosted the show for the second time.The nominees for the 4th Magritte Awards were announced on 9 January 2014. Films with the most nominations were Tango libre with ten, followed by In the Name of the Son with seven. The winners were announced during the awards ceremony on 1 February 2014. Ernest & Celestine
paraphrase: The Académie André Delvaux hosted the 4th Magritte Awards ceremony on February 1, 2014, at the Square in Mont des Arts, Brussels. The event recognized the best films of 2013 in Belgium and featured 21 categories of Magritte Awards. Émilie Dequenne presided over the ceremony, which was broadcasted on BeTV, while Fabrizio Rongione hosted for the second time. The nominees were announced on January 9, 2014, with Tango libre receiving the most nominations at ten and In the Name of the Son following with seven. The winners were revealed during the ceremony, with Ernest & Celestine being one of the recipients.

title: 2014–15 ISU Speed Skating World Cup – World Cup 3
input: The third competition weekend of the 2014–15 ISU Speed Skating World Cup will be held in Sportforum Hohenschönhausen in Berlin, Germany, from Friday, 5 December, until Sunday, 7 December 2014.Artur Waś of Poland both men's 500 m races. In the women's competitions, Ireen Wüst of the Netherlands won three gold medals; in the 1500 m and 3000 m races, as well as in the team pursuit. Lee Sang-hwa of South Korea won both 500 m races. Heather Richardson of the United States managed to take no less than four silver medals; in both 500 m races, as well as the 1000 m and 1500 m races.No world records were set during the weekend, but Christian Oberbichler of Switzerland set a new national record on in the B division
paraphrase: From Friday, 5 December, until Sunday, 7 December 2014, the Sportforum Hohenschönhausen in Berlin, Germany, will host the third competition weekend of the 2014-15 ISU Speed Skating World Cup. Artur Waś of Poland won both men's 500 m races, while Ireen Wüst of the Netherlands won three gold medals in the women's competitions, including the 1500 m and 3000 m races, as well as the team pursuit. Lee Sang-hwa of South Korea won both 500 m races, and Heather Richardson of the United States won four silver medals in the 500 m, 1000 m, and 1500 m races. Although no world records were set during the weekend, Christian Oberbichler of Switzerland set a new national record in the B division.

title: Cyclone Cheneso
input: Tropical Cyclone Cheneso was a strong tropical cyclone that affected Madagascar in January 2023. The fourth tropical storm and fifth tropical cyclone of the 2022–23 South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season, Cheneso developed out of a zone of disturbed weather status which was first monitored at RSMC La Réunion on 17 January. Despite convection wrapping into the curved band pattern, the system formed into a tropical depression on 18 January. The depression strengthened into Severe Tropical Storm Cheneso on the following day. Cheneso made landfall over northern Madagascar and weakened into an inland depression, before emerging into the Mozambique Channel. Cheneso later strengthened into a tropical cyclone on 25 January. The system continued moving southeast, before transitioning into a post-tropical depression on 29 January. The National Office for Risk
paraphrase: Management and Disaster (NORMAD) reported that Tropical Cyclone Cheneso, which hit Madagascar in January 2023, was a powerful storm and the fourth tropical storm and fifth tropical cyclone of the 2022-23 South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season. Initially, the system was a zone of disturbed weather that was first observed at RSMC La Réunion on 17 January. Despite the convection wrapping into a curved band pattern, the system developed into a tropical depression on 18 January and then into Severe Tropical Storm Cheneso on the following day. Cheneso made landfall over northern Madagascar, weakened into an inland depression, and then emerged into the Mozambique Channel. On 25 January, Cheneso strengthened into a tropical cyclone and continued moving southeast before transitioning into a post-tropical depression on 29 January. NORMAD provided this information.

title: Death and funeral of Constantine II of Greece
input: On 10 January 2023, Constantine II of Greece, Head of the Royal House of Greece, who reigned as the last King of the Hellenes from 6 March 1964 to 1 June 1973, died in Athens at the age of 82. After suffering a stroke in hospital, Constantine was placed in intensive care, before dying days later. His death was initially announced by an Associated Press report, which referenced hospital staff, however Constantine's private office later released a formal death statement. The Greek government declined the royal family's request for a state funeral, although it was later decided that Constantine should have a lying-in-state and a funeral procession. On 16 January, Constantine's body was laid for public viewing in the Agios Eleftherios Chapel in Athens from 6:00 am to
paraphrase: Constantine II of Greece, who served as the last King of the Hellenes from 1964 to 1973, passed away in Athens at the age of 82 on 10 January 2023. He had suffered a stroke and was admitted to the hospital's intensive care unit, where he eventually passed away. The news of his death was first reported by the Associated Press, citing hospital staff, but was later confirmed by Constantine's private office. The Greek government initially denied the royal family's request for a state funeral, but later agreed to hold a lying-in-state and funeral procession. On 16 January, Constantine's body was made available for public viewing at the Agios Eleftherios Chapel in Athens from 6:00 am onwards.

title: 2023 Pentagon document leaks
input: In April 2023, two sets of classified foreign intelligence documents of the United States began circulating on Twitter, Telegram, and 4chan. Jack Teixeira, an airman first class of the Massachusetts Air National Guard, had allegedly photographed printouts of the documents at his parents' home in Dighton, Massachusetts and posted them to the instant messaging platform Discord on a server named "Thug Shaker Central". The earliest posts dated to October 2022. The documents are primarily related to the Russo-Ukrainian War, but also include foreign intelligence assessments concerning nations including North Korea, China, Iran, and the United Arab Emirates. A subset of documents were shared to Discord servers for a YouTuber and the sandbox video game Minecraft in late February and early March 2023. In April, a 4chan user posted
paraphrase: In April 2023, confidential foreign intelligence documents belonging to the United States were leaked on social media platforms such as Twitter, Telegram, and 4chan. The source of the leak was allegedly Jack Teixeira, an airman first class of the Massachusetts Air National Guard, who had taken pictures of the documents at his parents' home in Dighton, Massachusetts and shared them on Discord under the server name "Thug Shaker Central". The earliest posts were made in October 2022. The documents mainly pertained to the Russo-Ukrainian War, but also contained intelligence assessments on countries such as North Korea, China, Iran, and the United Arab Emirates. Some of the documents were also shared on Discord servers for a YouTuber and the video game Minecraft in late February and early March 2023. A 4chan user later posted about the leak in April.

title: World news
input: World news or international news or even foreign coverage is the news media jargon for news from abroad, about a country or a global subject. For journalism, it is a branch that deals with news either sent by foreign correspondents or news agencies, or – more recently – information that is gathered or researched through distance communication technologies, such as telephone, satellite TV or the internet. Although in most of the English-speaking world this field is not usually regarded as a specific specialization for journalists, it is so in nearly all the world. Particularly in the United States, there is a blurred distinction between world news and "national" news when they include directly the national government or national institutions, such as wars in which the US are involved
paraphrase: The term "world news" refers to news from other countries or about global issues. This type of journalism involves reporting by foreign correspondents or news agencies, as well as gathering information through remote communication technologies like the internet or satellite TV. While this field is not typically considered a specialized area for journalists in English-speaking countries, it is in most other parts of the world. In the United States, there is often overlap between world news and "national" news when the latter involves the national government or institutions, such as during times of war involving the US.

title: Online newsroom
input: An online newsroom (also known as a pressroom, mediaroom, press center or media center) is a website, web page or site section that contains distributable information about a corporation or organization. The online newsroom was initially created for corporate communicators and public relations firms to target traditional media outlets, fundamentally newspapers, magazines, radio stations and television stations. Multiple public relations audience interests are now supported, including media relations, investor and analyst relations, community relations, and consumer social media relations. Most online newsrooms provide press releases and kits, photographs, logos, audio, video, executive biographies, contact information, events, company history and awards and honors. Sometimes, they also contain industry news feeds. Increasingly companies are aggregating their presence on various social media sites into their online newsrooms. Some newsrooms may accommodate
paraphrase: An online newsroom, also referred to as a pressroom, mediaroom, press center, or media center, is a section on a website that contains information about a corporation or organization that can be shared with the public. Initially, the online newsroom was created for corporate communicators and public relations firms to target traditional media outlets such as newspapers, magazines, radio stations, and television stations. However, it now caters to multiple public relations audience interests, including media relations, investor and analyst relations, community relations, and consumer social media relations. The majority of online newsrooms offer press releases and kits, photographs, logos, audio, video, executive biographies, contact information, events, company history, awards, and honors. Some may also include industry news feeds. Companies are increasingly consolidating their presence on various social media sites into their online newsrooms. title: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 satellite communications
input: The analysis of communications between Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 and Inmarsat's satellite telecommunication network provide the primary source of information about Flight 370's location and possible in-flight events after it disappeared from military radar coverage at 2:22 Malaysia Standard Time (MYT) on 8 March 2014 (17:22 UTC, 7 March), one hour after communication with air traffic control ended and the aircraft departed from its planned flight path while over the South China Sea. Flight 370 was a scheduled commercial flight with 227 passengers and 12 crew which departed Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia at 0:41 and was scheduled to land in Beijing, China at 6:30 China Standard Time (6:30 MYT; 22:30 UTC, 7 March). Malaysia has worked in conjunction with the Australian Transport Safety Bureau to co-ordinate the analysis, which
paraphrase: The main source of information regarding the location and potential events that occurred during Malaysia Airlines Flight 370's disappearance on March 8th, 2014, came from the analysis of communications between the flight and Inmarsat's satellite telecommunication network. The flight disappeared from military radar coverage at 2:22 Malaysia Standard Time, one hour after losing communication with air traffic control and deviating from its planned flight path over the South China Sea. The flight was carrying 227 passengers and 12 crew members and was scheduled to land in Beijing, China. Malaysia and the Australian Transport Safety Bureau worked together to analyze the data.

title: 2023 Moscow rally
input: A concert and rally took place on 22 February 2023 at Luzhniki Stadium in Moscow. TASS reported that the rally commemorated Defender of the Fatherland Day. Ukrainska Pravda stated that the date was selected in reference to the starting date of the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine, 24 February 2022.RBC reported that President Vladimir Putin was expected to make an appearance, and RIA Novosti reported that a parliamentary source stated that Putin would speak at the rally. Ukrainska Pravda added that historical exhibits and Russian military equipment would also be on display. Argumenty i Fakty reported that around 200,000 people were expected to attend. Radio Liberty stated that people were being offered 500 RUB to attend a rally in Moscow, and presumed that the offer was for this

According to TASS, the event was organized for this purpose. However, Ukrainska Pravda claimed that the date was chosen to mark the beginning of the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine on 24 February 2022. RBC reported that President Vladimir Putin was anticipated to attend, and RIA Novosti cited a parliamentary source who claimed that Putin would speak at the rally. Ukrainska Pravda also mentioned that historical exhibits and Russian military equipment would be on display. Argumenty i Fakty estimated that approximately 200,000 people would attend. Radio Liberty reported that individuals were being offered 500 RUB to participate in a rally in Moscow, and it was assumed that this offer was for the same event.

title: Marchetti's constant
input: Marchetti's constant is the average time spent by a person for commuting each day. Its value is approximately one hour, or half an hour for a one-way trip. It is named after Italian physicist Cesare Marchetti, though Marchetti himself attributed the "one hour" finding to transportation analyst and engineer Yacov Zahavi.Marchetti posits that although forms of urban planning and transport may change, and although some live in villages and others in cities, people gradually adjust their lives to their conditions (including location of their homes relative to their workplace) such that the average travel time stays approximately constant. Ever since Neolithic times, people have kept the average time spent per day for travel the same, even though the distance may increase due to the advancements in the means
paraphrase:
of transportation.

The Marchetti constant refers to the typical amount of time an individual spends commuting daily, with an average of one hour or half an hour for a one-way trip. It is named after Cesare Marchetti, an Italian physicist, although he credited transportation analyst and engineer Yacov Zahavi for the "one hour" discovery. Marchetti's theory suggests that despite changes in urban planning and transportation, people adapt their lifestyles to maintain a consistent average travel time, regardless of whether they live in cities or villages. This trend has persisted since ancient times, with people maintaining a constant daily travel time even as transportation methods have advanced and distances have increased.

title: 2014 Kalbajar incident
input: 2014 Kalbajar incident refers to the crossing of a small group of Azerbaijanis into Kalbajar district, their subsequent capture and conviction for murder and sabotage by the Republic of Artsakh. In July 2014, three ethnic Azerbaijanis crossed Nagorno-Karabakh Line of Contact in to Kalbajar District, then controlled by breakaway Republic of Artsakh forces. This was followed by disappearance of 17-year-old local Smbat Tsakanyan who was later found dead from gunshot wounds and who was last seen walking with the Azerbaijanis in a video used as evidence in the trial. The Azerbaijanis were detained for "reconnaissance operations in the area on orders from Azerbaijan’s intelligence service," as well as kidnapping and killing of Tsakanyan. One of the Azerbaijanis named Hasanov attacked Major Sargis Abrahamyan and his companion Karine Davtyan
paraphrase: The 2014 Kalbajar incident pertains to a small group of Azerbaijanis who trespassed into the Kalbajar district, were apprehended, and found guilty of murder and sabotage by the Republic of Artsakh. In July of that year, three Azerbaijanis crossed the Nagorno-Karabakh Line of Contact into the Kalbajar District, which was then under the control of the breakaway Republic of Artsakh. Shortly after, a local 17-year-old named Smbat Tsakanyan went missing and was later discovered dead from gunshot wounds. The Azerbaijanis were arrested for their involvement in reconnaissance operations in the area, as well as the kidnapping and murder of Tsakanyan. One of the Azerbaijanis, Hasanov, attacked Major Sargis Abrahamyan and his companion Karine Davtyan. The video footage of Tsakanyan walking with the Azerbaijanis was used as evidence in the trial.

title: 2014 Paris municipal election
input: The 2014 Paris Municipal elections took place on 23 and 30 March 2014, at the same time as other French municipal elections. Anne Hidalgo of the Socialist Party was elected mayor of Paris, becoming the first woman to hold that position. She had been the city's deputy mayor. Hidalgo won with around 55% of the vote in the second round. Her principal opponent was Nathalie Kosciusko-Morizet of the UMP who had finished ahead of Hidalgo in first round of voting on 23 March. Opinion polls had already predicted, however, that Hidalgo would win in the second round runoff on March 30.The outgoing mayor was the Socialists' Bertrand Delanoë, who did not run for a third term. Control of Paris' twenty arrondissements was also decided in the elections. Ten
paraphrase: The Paris Municipal elections of 2014 were held on March 23 and 30, coinciding with other French municipal elections. Anne Hidalgo, who had previously served as the city's deputy mayor, became the first woman to be elected as mayor of Paris, representing the Socialist Party. In the second round of voting, Hidalgo won with approximately 55% of the vote, defeating her main opponent Nathalie Kosciusko-Morizet of the UMP, who had received more votes than Hidalgo in the first round on March 23. Despite this, opinion polls had already predicted Hidalgo's victory in the second round runoff on March 30. The outgoing mayor, Bertrand Delanoë of the Socialist Party, did not seek a third term. The elections also determined control of Paris' twenty arrondissements, with ten being won by the Socialists.

title: Cyclones Judy and Kevin
input: Cyclones Judy and Kevin were a pair of intense tropical cyclones that made landfall on the Pacific island nation of Vanuatu within 48 hours of each other in March 2023. They were the fourth and fifth named storms of the 2022–23 South Pacific cyclone season respectively, as well as the second and third severe tropical cyclones of the season. By the end of February, Judy had affected the Solomon Islands, and shortly after, Kevin began to affect the country. The nations were pounded by powerful winds and destructive seas. Vanuatu was heavily affected, being struck by both cyclones two days apart. The government asked Australia and New Zealand for aid shortly after Judy's passage. During 3 March, as Kevin was impacting the islands, a magnitude 6.5 earthquake hit
paraphrase: In March 2023, two intense tropical cyclones named Judy and Kevin hit the Pacific island nation of Vanuatu within a 48-hour period. These were the fourth and fifth named storms of the 2022-23 South Pacific cyclone season and the second and third severe tropical cyclones of the season. Judy had already affected the Solomon Islands by the end of February, and shortly after, Kevin began to affect the country. Both cyclones caused significant damage to Vanuatu, with the government requesting aid from Australia and New Zealand after Judy's passage. On 3 March, while Kevin was still impacting the islands, a magnitude 6.5 earthquake occurred.

title: Colombian peace process
input: The Colombian peace process is the peace process between the Colombian government of President Juan Manuel Santos and the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC–EP) to bring an end to the Colombian conflict, which eventually led to the Peace Agreements between the Colombian Government of Juan Manuel Santos and FARC-EP. Negotiations began in September 2012, and mainly took place in Havana, Cuba. Negotiators announced a final agreement to end the conflict and build a lasting peace on August 24, 2016. However, a referendum to ratify the deal on October 2, 2016 was unsuccessful after 50.2% of voters voted against the agreement with 49.8% voting in favor. Afterward, the Colombian government and the FARC signed a revised peace deal on November 24 and sent it to Congress for ratification
paraphrase: The Colombian peace process refers to the efforts made by President Juan Manuel Santos and the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC-EP) to put an end to the Colombian conflict. The negotiations began in September 2012 and were mainly held in Havana, Cuba. On August 24, 2016, negotiators announced a final agreement to end the conflict and establish a lasting peace. However, the agreement was not ratified in a referendum held on October 2, 2016, as 50.2% of voters opposed it. A revised peace deal was signed by the Colombian government and the FARC on November 24 and was sent to Congress for ratification.

title: Local news
input: In journalism, local news refers to coverage of events, by the news, in a local context that would not be an interest of another locality, or otherwise be of national or international scope. Local news, in contrast to national or international news, caters to the news of their regional and local communities; they focus on more localized issues and events. Some key features of local newsrooms includes regional politics, weather, business, and human interest stories. Local news readership has been declining in recent years, according to a recent study. And as more and more television consumers tap into streamed programming, local news viewership is beginning to decline. Nikki Usher, an associate professor at the College of Media at the University of Illinois, argued in The Complicated Future of

However, recent studies have shown a decline in local news readership, which is attributed to the increasing popularity of streamed programming among television consumers. title: International Year of Basic Sciences for Sustainable Development
input: The International Year of Basic Sciences for Sustainable Development was proclaimed by the 76th session of the United Nations General Assembly 2 December 2021 for 2022, stressing that the applications of basic sciences are vital for advances in medicine, industry, agriculture, water resources, energy planning, environment, communications and culture, and that basic sciences rupture technologies respond to the needs of humankind by providing access to information and increasing societal well-being, and promoting peace through improved collaboration toward Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The official opening ceremony of the year took place in UNESCO headquarters in Paris on 8 July 2022. The official closure is planned to take place at CERN in Geneva on 15 December 2023.The International Union of Pure and Applied Physics (IUPAP) and 28 other science unions
paraphrase: The United Nations General Assembly declared the year 2022 as the International Year of Basic Sciences for Sustainable Development on December 2, 2021. The declaration emphasized the importance of basic sciences in various fields such as medicine, industry, agriculture, water resources, energy planning, environment, communications, and culture. It also highlighted that basic sciences can provide access to information, increase societal well-being, and promote peace through improved collaboration towards Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The opening ceremony of the year was held at UNESCO headquarters in Paris on July 8, 2022, while the official closure is scheduled to take place at CERN in Geneva on December 15, 2023. The International Union of Pure and Applied Physics (IUPAP) and 28 other science unions are involved in this initiative.

title: 2023 United States debt-ceiling crisis
input: On January 19, 2023, the United States hit its debt ceiling, beginning an ongoing debt-ceiling crisis. In response, Janet Yellen, the secretary of the treasury, began enacting temporary "extraordinary measures". The crisis is part of a political debate within Congress about federal government spending and the national debt that the U.S. government accrues.In the United States, the debt ceiling is a limit on how much national debt the Treasury Department may incur, defined by Congress. Although the debt ceiling does not authorize new spending, it grants the Treasury greater power over financial endeavors Congress may choose to take. In January 2013, the United States hit the debt ceiling, causing a crisis that persisted until that October, when the Continuing Appropriations Act of 2014 was signed into law by
paraphrase: Janet Yellen, the secretary of the treasury, implemented temporary "extraordinary measures" in response to the ongoing debt-ceiling crisis that began on January 19, 2023 in the United States. This crisis is a result of a political debate within Congress regarding federal government spending and the national debt. The debt ceiling is a limit set by Congress on the amount of national debt that the Treasury Department can incur. Although it does not authorize new spending, it grants the Treasury Department greater control over financial endeavors that Congress may choose to undertake. A similar crisis occurred in January 2013, which lasted until October of that year when the Continuing Appropriations Act of 2014 was signed into law.

title: Rey de Reyes (2023)
input: The 2023 Rey de Reyes (Spanish for "2023 King of Kings") was a professional wrestling tournament and supercard event produced by the Mexican Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide (AAA) promotion. The event was held on February 5, 2023, at Poliforum Zamna in Merida, Yucatan, Mexico. The 2023 event was the 26th Rey de Reyes show and tournament. In the main event match, Sam Adonis defeated Bandido, Pagano, and Hijo del Vikingo to become the 2023 Rey de Reyes. In other prominent matches, Sexy Star II defeated Chik Tormenta, Lady Shani, La Hiedra, and Dalys in a five-way match to become the 2023 Reina de Reinas and Negro Casas made his AAA in-ring debut, losing to Hijo del Vikingo in a Rey de Reyes qualifier that also involved Myzteziz Jr.
paraphrase: The Mexican Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide (AAA) promotion organized the 2023 Rey de Reyes, a professional wrestling tournament and supercard event. It took place on February 5, 2023, at Poliforum Zamna in Merida, Yucatan, Mexico, and was the 26th Rey de Reyes show and tournament. Sam Adonis emerged as the 2023 Rey de Reyes after defeating Bandido, Pagano, and Hijo del Vikingo in the main event. Sexy Star II won the 2023 Reina de Reinas title by defeating Chik Tormenta, Lady Shani, La Hiedra, and Dalys in a five-way match. Additionally, Negro Casas made his AAA in-ring debut but lost to Hijo del Vikingo in a Rey de Reyes qualifier that also featured Myzteziz Jr.

title: 2022–present Ukrainian refugee crisis
input: An ongoing refugee crisis began in Europe in late February 2022 after Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Over 8.1 million refugees fleeing Ukraine have been recorded across Europe, while an estimated 8 million others had been displaced within the country by late May 2022. Approximately one-quarter of the country's total population had left their homes in Ukraine by 20 March. 90% of Ukrainian refugees are women and children, while most Ukrainian men age 18 to 60 are banned from leaving the country. By 24 March, more than half of all children in Ukraine had left their homes, of whom a quarter had left the country. The invasion caused Europe's largest refugee crisis since World War II and its aftermath, is the first of its kind in Europe since the
paraphrase: In late February 2022, Europe was hit by an ongoing refugee crisis triggered by Russia's invasion of Ukraine. As of late May 2022, over 8.1 million refugees have fled Ukraine and sought refuge in various parts of Europe, while an estimated 8 million others have been displaced within the country. By 20 March, around 25% of Ukraine's total population had left their homes. The majority of Ukrainian refugees are women and children, with most Ukrainian men aged 18 to 60 prohibited from leaving the country. By 24 March, more than half of all children in Ukraine had left their homes, with a quarter of them leaving the country. This crisis is the largest refugee crisis in Europe since World War II and the first of its kind in the region since the invasion.

title: Azerbaijan in the Eurovision Song Contest 2014
input: Azerbaijan participated in the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 with the song "Start a Fire" written by Stefan Örn, Johan Kronlund and Alessandra Günthardt. The song was performed by Dilara Kazimova. The Azerbaijani Eurovision entrant for the 2014 contest in Copenhagen, Denmark was selected through Böyük Səhnə, a talent show organised by the Azerbaijani broadcaster İctimai Television (İTV). Following three elimination shows and a final on 2 March 2014, a five-member jury selected Dilara Kazimova as the winner. The song "Start a Fire" was internally selected and presented to the public on 16 March. Azerbaijan was drawn to compete in the first semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest which took place on 6 May 2014. Performing during the show in position 8, "Start a Fire" was announced among the
paraphrase: participants of the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 representing Azerbaijan. The song, titled "Start a Fire", was written by Stefan Örn, Johan Kronlund, and Alessandra Günthardt and performed by Dilara Kazimova. The Azerbaijani representative for the contest was chosen through a talent show called Böyük Səhnə, organized by İctimai Television. Dilara Kazimova was selected as the winner by a five-member jury after three elimination shows and a final on 2 March 2014. The song was presented to the public on 16 March and Azerbaijan competed in the first semi-final of the contest on 6 May 2014, performing in position 8. "Start a Fire" was announced as the Azerbaijani entry for the Eurovision Song Contest.

title: 2013–2015 detention of Al Jazeera journalists by Egypt
input: On December 29, 2013, three journalists working for the Qatari-based international news channel Al Jazeera English, Australian Peter Greste, Canadian Mohamed Fahmy and Egyptian Baher Mohamed were taken into custody by Egyptian security forces at the Marriott Hotel in Cairo following a raid at their room, which was used for the news channel's remote studio. The Egyptian Interior Ministry confirmed the arrest and said the journalists were accused of reporting false news which was "damaging to national security".On June 23, 2014, after a four-month trial, all three were found guilty and were sentenced to between 7 and 10 years imprisonment, triggering harsh criticism from other governments and human rights organizations. A day later, Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi declared that he would not interfere with judicial rulings.In February
paraphrase: 2013, Egyptian security forces arrested three journalists working for Al Jazeera English, namely Peter Greste from Australia, Mohamed Fahmy from Canada, and Baher Mohamed from Egypt. The arrest took place at the Marriott Hotel in Cairo, where the journalists were using a room as a remote studio for the news channel. The Egyptian Interior Ministry accused the journalists of reporting false news that was detrimental to national security. After a four-month trial, the journalists were found guilty and sentenced to 7 to 10 years in prison, which drew criticism from various governments and human rights organizations. Despite the backlash, Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi refused to interfere with the judicial decision.

title: Humanitarian situation during the war in Donbas
input: During the ongoing Russo-Ukrainian War between the Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists in the Donbas region of Ukraine that began in April 2014, many international organisations and states noted a deteriorating humanitarian situation in the conflict zone. A May 2014 report by the United Nations said there had been an "alarming deterioration" in human rights in territory held by Russian separatists affiliated with the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). The UN Human Rights Monitoring Mission in Ukraine (HRMMU) reported growing lawlessness in the region, documenting cases of targeted killings, torture, and abduction. HRMMU also reported threats against, attacks on, and abductions of journalists and international observers, as well as the beatings and attacks on supporters of Ukrainian unity. A report by Human Rights
paraphrase: Watch in May 2014 highlighted the worsening humanitarian situation in the Donbas region of Ukraine, where the ongoing Russo-Ukrainian War between the Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists began in April 2014. The report noted that international organizations and states had expressed concern about the deteriorating situation in the conflict zone. The United Nations reported an "alarming deterioration" in human rights in areas controlled by Russian separatists affiliated with the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). The UN Human Rights Monitoring Mission in Ukraine (HRMMU) documented growing lawlessness in the region, including targeted killings, torture, and abduction. HRMMU also reported threats, attacks, and abductions of journalists and international observers, as well as violence against supporters of Ukrainian unity. Human Rights Watch also reported on the worsening humanitarian situation in the region.

title: 2014 Australian federal budget
input: The 2014 Australian federal budget was the federal budget to fund government services and operations for the 2014/15 financial year. The 2014 budget was the first delivered by the Abbott government, since the Coalition's victory in the 2013 Australian federal election. Treasurer Joe Hockey presented the budget to the House of Representatives on 13 May 2014.The budget featured significant changes to address a perceived deficit crisis. This included a proposed dramatic downsizing of government bureaucracy, and contained significant changes to welfare, new initiatives for a medical research fund and spending on roads. A budget surplus exceeding 1% of GDP was not expected until 2023.The austere budget faced widespread criticism and was overwhelmingly rejected by the Australian public as reflected in all opinion polls after its release. Opposition to
paraphrase: In 2014, the Australian federal budget was created to finance government services and operations for the 2014/15 financial year. It was the first budget presented by the Abbott government after their victory in the 2013 Australian federal election. The Treasurer, Joe Hockey, presented the budget to the House of Representatives on May 13, 2014. The budget aimed to address a perceived deficit crisis by proposing significant changes such as downsizing government bureaucracy, altering welfare policies, introducing a medical research fund, and increasing spending on roads. However, it was not expected to achieve a budget surplus exceeding 1% of GDP until 2023. Despite these efforts, the austere budget was widely criticized and rejected by the Australian public, as evidenced by all opinion polls conducted after its release.
