title: Talking Statues
input: Talking Statues is a project created initially in 2013 by David Peter Fox in Copenhagen, Denmark involving pre-recorded voiceovers accompanying various statues available in a smartphone app. The statue of Hans Christian Andersen in the King's Garden in Copenhagen was the first talking statue in the world. Later the idea was applied in Helsinki, New York, London, San Diego, Chicago, Vilnius, Parma, Dublin, Berlin, Manchester, and others. The project works with mobile technology and activated through a QR code found on the statue, when you scan it you will be called. You can also download our app, then you can find the Talking Statues in the world and have it talk to GPS so that they call you on your smartphone when you get close to the statue.
paraphrase: In 2013, David Peter Fox created Talking Statues, a project that involves pre-recorded voiceovers accompanying various statues that can be accessed through a smartphone app. The first talking statue in the world was the statue of Hans Christian Andersen in the King's Garden in Copenhagen. The project has since been implemented in various cities such as Helsinki, New York, London, San Diego, Chicago, Vilnius, Parma, Dublin, Berlin, and Manchester. The project utilizes mobile technology and can be activated through a QR code found on the statue. Alternatively, users can download the app and use GPS to locate and interact with the Talking Statues.

title: 2014 Wang–Zhang meetings
input: In 2014, a series of groundbreaking diplomatic meetings was held between Wang Yu-chi, in his official capacity as the Minister of the Mainland Affairs Council (MAC) of the Republic of China (ROC), and Zhang Zhijun, the Minister of the Taiwan Affairs Office (TAO) of the People's Republic of China (PRC). The first meeting took place in Nanjing on 11 February 2014 when Wang visited mainland China, the very first official contact between the two governments across the Taiwan Strait after the end of Chinese Civil War in 1949. The tour of Wang and his delegates lasted from 11 to 14 February in Nanjing and Shanghai.On 25–28 June 2014, Zhang paid a retrospective visit to Taiwan in order to rebuild ties in the aftermath of the Sunflower Movement. It
paraphrase: In 2014, the Minister of the Mainland Affairs Council (MAC) of the Republic of China (ROC), Wang Yu-chi, and the Minister of the Taiwan Affairs Office (TAO) of the People's Republic of China (PRC), Zhang Zhijun, held a series of significant diplomatic meetings. The first meeting occurred on 11 February 2014 in Nanjing, marking the first official contact between the two governments across the Taiwan Strait since the end of the Chinese Civil War in 1949. Wang and his delegation visited Nanjing and Shanghai from 11 to 14 February. Later, from 25 to 28 June 2014, Zhang visited Taiwan to rebuild ties after the Sunflower Movement.

title: 2014 Gaza Valley airstrike
input: The 2014 Gaza Valley airstrike was a friendly fire incident that took place in Zabul Province, Afghanistan on 9 June 2014 when five U.S. troops and one Afghan interpreter were killed when a B-1B Lancer bomber inadvertently dropped laser-guided bombs on their position during a firefight with Taliban forces. U.S. and Afghan government forces were in the Gaza Valley area of Arghandab District conducting security operations in advance of the 2014 Afghan presidential elections when they came under attack from Taliban militants, sparking a firefight. An American air controller on the ground requested close air support from a B-1B bomber flying in the vicinity to support a team of soldiers maneuvering on a ridge. The U.S. aircraft dropped two guided bombs on the position, killing the team of

title: Ed Miliband bacon sandwich photograph
input: A photograph of then-Labour Party leader Ed Miliband eating a bacon sandwich became a source of sustained commentary and the subject of an internet meme in 2014 and 2015. Taken for the London Evening Standard newspaper while Miliband was campaigning for local elections in May 2014, the image became well known following the popular perception of it as making Miliband appear awkward, error-prone and incapable of performing simple tasks. The image sparked several internet memes, both supportive and mocking, and fuelled a debate about the lengths to which politicians attempt to control their public image, as well as drawing criticism that the focus placed on the image and its resulting memes was motivated by antisemitism. Miliband dismissed the debate as unimportant. Others, including opponents, described the media focus
paraphrase: In 2014 and 2015, a photograph of Ed Miliband, the then-leader of the Labour Party, eating a bacon sandwich gained widespread attention and became an internet meme. The picture was taken by the London Evening Standard during Miliband's campaign for local elections in May 2014. Many people perceived the image as making Miliband look awkward, incompetent, and unable to perform simple tasks. This led to the creation of several internet memes, some of which were supportive while others were mocking. The incident sparked a debate about the extent to which politicians try to control their public image, and some criticized the focus on the image and its memes as being motivated by antisemitism. Miliband himself dismissed the debate as unimportant, while his opponents and others in the media continued to discuss it.

title: 2014 Egyptian presidential election
input: Presidential elections were held in Egypt between 26 and 28 May 2014. There were only two candidates, former Egyptian defence minister Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and Egyptian Popular Current candidate Hamdeen Sabahi. El-Sisi won the election in a landslide victory, having received 97% of votes. Before announcing his candidacy in the election, el-Sisi, who as Defence Minister also served as Commander-in-Chief of the Egyptian Armed Forces, was responsible for officially announcing the removal of president Mohamed Morsi from office in the aftermath of the June 2013 Egyptian protests. After Morsi's removal, Sisi installed a temporary interim government, but remained Egypt's Minister of Defence and assumed the role of the country's First Deputy Prime Minister. On 26 March 2014, he officially retired from the military, and announced that he would
paraphrase: In May 2014, Egypt held presidential elections with only two candidates: Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, a former defence minister and Commander-in-Chief of the Egyptian Armed Forces, and Hamdeen Sabahi from the Egyptian Popular Current party. El-Sisi won the election by a large margin, receiving 97% of the votes. Prior to running for president, el-Sisi was responsible for announcing the removal of former president Mohamed Morsi from office after the 2013 protests. Following Morsi's removal, el-Sisi established a temporary interim government and continued to serve as Minister of Defence and First Deputy Prime Minister. He retired from the military in March 2014 and announced his candidacy for president.

title: Wrestle Kingdom 17
input: Wrestle Kingdom 17 was a two-day professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event co-produced by the New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) and Pro Wrestling Noah (Noah) promotions. The first day of the event took place on January 4, 2023, at the Tokyo Dome in Tokyo, Japan and the second day of the event took place on January 21, 2023, at the Yokohama Arena in Yokohama, Japan. It is the 32nd January 4 Tokyo Dome Show and the 17th promoted under the Wrestle Kingdom name. The event was held in honor of the NJPW founder Antonio Inoki, who died on October 1, 2022. In the main event of night 1, Kazuchika Okada defeated Jay White to win the IWGP World Heavyweight Championship. In other prominent matches, Kenny Omega defeated Will Ospreay to

The event was held in honor of the NJPW founder Antonio Inoki, who passed away on October 1, 2022. The main event of night 1 saw Kazuchika Okada defeat Jay White to become the new IWGP World Heavyweight Champion. Other notable matches included Kenny Omega's victory over Will Ospreay.

title: Abkhazian Revolution
input: The Abkhazian Revolution took place in 2014, when President Aleksandr Ankvab resigned after hundreds of demonstrators stormed his office. After mass protests in the capital Sukhumi and the occupation of his office on 27 May, Ankvab fled to his hometown of Gudauta and ultimately resigned on 1 June, after previously denouncing the demonstration as an attempted coup d'état.The uprising was attributed to public anger with Ankvab over his perceived liberal policy toward ethnic Georgians in Abkhazia, a breakaway republic with limited recognition. Although Abkhazia seceded from Georgia in 1992, the Ankvab administration allowed ethnic Georgians to register as voters and receive Abkhazian passports.The revolution led to an early presidential election being called in August 2014. Opposition leader Raul Khajimba was elected president with a narrow majority of the
paraphrase: In 2014, the Abkhazian Revolution occurred when President Aleksandr Ankvab resigned following a group of demonstrators storming his office. Ankvab fled to his hometown of Gudauta after mass protests in the capital Sukhumi and ultimately resigned on 1 June, despite previously denouncing the demonstration as an attempted coup d'état. The uprising was caused by public dissatisfaction with Ankvab's perceived lenient policy towards ethnic Georgians in Abkhazia, a breakaway republic with limited recognition. Despite Abkhazia's secession from Georgia in 1992, the Ankvab administration allowed ethnic Georgians to register as voters and receive Abkhazian passports. The revolution resulted in an early presidential election being held in August 2014, which saw opposition leader Raul Khajimba elected as president with a narrow majority.

title: 13N (Argentina)
input: The 13N was a Cacerolazo against President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner that took place in Argentina on November 13, 2014. It was organized by social networks. The people in the demonstration protested against the high crime rate, the high inflation and the corruption scandals. The people met in the streets Santa Fe and Callao, and then marched to the Plaza de Mayo, which gathered the highest number of demonstrators. There was a strong security network at the Plaza de Mayo and the Congressional Plaza. The demonstration a lower number of demonstrators than previous ones such as the 8N and the 18A.Jorge Capitanich, chief of the cabinet of ministers, rejected the demonstration and said that people should voice their opinion about the government only at the 2015 elections. ==
paraphrase: On November 13, 2014, a Cacerolazo called 13N was held in Argentina, organized through social media to protest against President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner. The demonstrators were unhappy with the high crime rate, inflation, and corruption scandals. The protest began at Santa Fe and Callao streets and ended at Plaza de Mayo, which had the highest number of participants. Security was tight at Plaza de Mayo and Congressional Plaza. The number of participants was lower than previous protests like 8N and 18A. Jorge Capitanich, the cabinet chief, dismissed the demonstration and suggested that people should express their views through the 2015 elections.

title: 2023 Stanley Cup playoffs
input: The 2023 Stanley Cup playoffs is the ongoing playoff tournament of the National Hockey League (NHL) for the 2022–23 season. The playoffs began on April 17, 2023, three days after the end of the regular season, and will end in June 2023 with the 2023 Stanley Cup Finals, to determine the winner of the Stanley Cup.The Boston Bruins made the playoffs as the Presidents' Trophy winners with the most points (i.e. best record) during the regular season. The Pittsburgh Penguins failed to make the playoffs for the first time since the 2005–06 NHL season, ending the NHL's longest active playoff streak at sixteen consecutive seasons. The longest active streak moved to the Boston Bruins and Toronto Maple Leafs at seven consecutive seasons after the Nashville Predators and Washington
paraphrase: The 2023 NHL playoffs are currently taking place, marking the end of the 2022-23 season. The playoffs began on April 17, 2023, and will conclude in June 2023 with the 2023 Stanley Cup Finals, which will determine the winner of the Stanley Cup. The Boston Bruins secured a spot in the playoffs as the Presidents' Trophy winners with the most points during the regular season. Meanwhile, the Pittsburgh Penguins failed to qualify for the playoffs for the first time since the 2005-06 NHL season, ending their 16-season playoff streak. The longest active streak now belongs to the Boston Bruins and Toronto Maple Leafs, who have both made the playoffs for seven consecutive seasons, following the Nashville Predators and Washington.

title: 2014–2016 Croatian war veterans protest
input: 2014–2016 Croatian war veterans tent protest was 555 days long war veterans protest, often dubbed in Croatia as The Tenters (Croatian: šatoraši). The protests were initially aimed against Ministry of Croatian Veterans deputy Bojan Glavašević and Minister Predrag Matić himself, however the protesters subsequently changed their demands and started demanding the resignation of left-wing Prime Minister Zoran Milanović and then President Ivo Josipović. The protests escalated in May 2015 when a group of protesters breached the riot police cordons in Zagreb Upper Town and barricaded themselves inside St. Mark Church, where they again clashed with the police. At the same time another group of protesters near the central tent blocked the traffic and brought out gas bottles on Savska street which they apparently threatened to blow if the
paraphrase: From 2014 to 2016, Croatian war veterans held a protest that lasted for 555 days. The protest was commonly referred to as "The Tenters" in Croatia. Initially, the protest was directed towards the Ministry of Croatian Veterans deputy Bojan Glavašević and Minister Predrag Matić. However, the protesters later changed their demands and began calling for the resignation of left-wing Prime Minister Zoran Milanović and then President Ivo Josipović. In May 2015, the protests intensified when a group of protesters breached the riot police cordons in Zagreb Upper Town and barricaded themselves inside St. Mark Church, leading to clashes with the police. At the same time, another group of protesters near the central tent blocked traffic and threatened to blow up gas bottles on Savska street.

title: 2013–2014 Atlantic winter storms in Europe
input: 2013–2014 Atlantic winter storms in Europe were a series of winter storms affecting areas of Atlantic Europe and beyond. The French Atlantic coastal regions (chiefly Brittany), South West and Southern England, West Wales, Ireland, Spanish Atlantic coastal regions (particularly Galicia) were especially affected by a "conveyor belt" series of high-precipitation storms (mostly not exceptional for their winds) and by high tides. Many storms were explosively deepened by a strong jet stream, many deepening below 950 hPa. The repeated formation of large deep lows over the Atlantic brought storm surges and large waves which coincided with some of the highest astronomical tides of the year and caused coastal damage. The low pressure areas brought heavy rainfalls which led to flooding, which became most severe over parts of England such
paraphrase: The winter storms that occurred in Europe during 2013-2014 impacted various regions of Atlantic Europe and beyond. The areas that were most affected included the French Atlantic coastal regions, South West and Southern England, West Wales, Ireland, and Spanish Atlantic coastal regions, particularly Galicia. These storms were characterized by a series of high-precipitation events, rather than exceptional winds, and were often intensified by a strong jet stream, resulting in many deepening below 950 hPa. The formation of large deep lows over the Atlantic caused storm surges and large waves, which coincided with some of the highest astronomical tides of the year, leading to coastal damage. Additionally, heavy rainfall caused flooding, which was most severe in parts of England.

title: Premio Lo Nuestro 2023
input: The 35th Lo Nuestro Awards were held at the Dade Arena in Miami on February 23, 2023, to recognize the most popular Spanish-language music of 2022. The ceremony will be broadcast on Univisión and will be hosted by television presenters Alejandra Espinoza and Adrián Uribe and singers Sebastián Yatra and Paulina Rubio.The nominees were announced on January 23, 2023, with Colombian singer Sebastián Yatra leading with ten nominations, followed by Bad Bunny, Becky G, Camilo and Grupo Firme, all with nine. Seven new categories were added increasing the number of categories to thirty-nine, these categories are: Regional Mexican New Artist of the Year, Tour of the Year, Male Pop Artist of the Year, Female Pop Artist of the Year, Tropical Album of the Year, Male Regional Mexican Artist

The ceremony will be aired on Univisión and will be hosted by Alejandra Espinoza, Adrián Uribe, Sebastián Yatra, and Paulina Rubio. The nominees were revealed on January 23, 2023, with Sebastián Yatra receiving the most nominations, followed by Bad Bunny, Becky G, Camilo, and Grupo Firme, all with nine. The number of categories increased to thirty-nine, with the addition of seven new categories, including Regional Mexican New Artist of the Year, Tour of the Year, Male Pop Artist of the Year, Female Pop Artist of the Year, Tropical Album of the Year, Male Regional Mexican Artist of the Year, and Female Regional Mexican Artist of the Year.

title: 2022–2023 North Kosovo crisis
input: Beginning on 31 July 2022, tensions between Serbia and Kosovo heightened due to the expiration of the eleven-year validity period of documents for cars on 1 August 2022, between the government of Kosovo and the Serbs in North Kosovo. Kosovo, which declared independence in 2008, signed an agreement with Serbia in 2011 that concluded on the use of license plates in North Kosovo. This agreement was supposed to change license plates from the ones that were issued by Serbia to neutral ones. The agreement was extended in 2016 and it expired in 2021 after which a crisis occurred and it ended with an agreement that ended the ban of Kosovo-issued license plates in Serbia. After the announcement that Serbian citizens who enter Kosovo will receive entry and exit
paraphrase: Starting from 31 July 2022, tensions between Serbia and Kosovo escalated due to the expiration of car document validity on 1 August 2022. This was a result of an agreement signed in 2011 between Kosovo and Serbia, which aimed to replace license plates issued by Serbia with neutral ones in North Kosovo. The agreement was extended in 2016 and expired in 2021, leading to a crisis that ended with a new agreement allowing Kosovo-issued license plates in Serbia. The recent announcement that Serbian citizens entering Kosovo will be allowed entry and exit has further added to the tension.

title: MINUSCA
input: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (also called MINUSCA, which is an initialism of its French name Mission multidimensionnelle intégrée des Nations unies pour la stabilisation en Centrafrique) is a UN peacekeeping mission, which started on April 10, 2014, to protect Central African Republic civilians under Chapter VII of the UN Charter. It transformed the 6,000-strong African Union-led peacekeeping force known as MISCA into a UN peacekeeping mission and became operational on September 15, 2014. The UN deployed a transition team to set up MINUSCA and prepare for a seamless transition of authority from MISCA to MINUSCA. As of 30 September 2021, it has more than 15,000 troops, police and civilian personnel on the ground. Its role is to: support for the transition
paraphrase: The United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic, also known as MINUSCA, is a UN peacekeeping mission that began on April 10, 2014. Its purpose is to safeguard the citizens of the Central African Republic under Chapter VII of the UN Charter. The mission replaced the African Union-led peacekeeping force, MISCA, which had 6,000 members, and became operational on September 15, 2014. The UN sent a transition team to establish MINUSCA and ensure a smooth transfer of power from MISCA to MINUSCA. As of September 30, 2021, the mission has over 15,000 troops, police, and civilian personnel on the ground. Its primary objective is to provide support for the transition.

title: Viscount Knollys
input: Viscount Knollys (), of Caversham in the County of Oxford, is a title in the Peerage of the United Kingdom. It was created in 1911 for the court official Francis Knollys, 1st Baron Knollys, Private Secretary to the Sovereign from 1901 to 1913. He had been previously created Baron Knollys, of Caversham in the County of Oxford, on 21 July 1902. His son, the second Viscount, served as Governor of Bermuda. As of 2023 the titles are held by the latter's grandson, the fourth Viscount, who succeeded in 2023. The third Viscountess Knollys (d. 2022) was a sister of Baron Farnham: she served as Vice Lord-Lieutenant of Norfolk.The Viscounts Knollys are members of the prominent Knollys family (pronounced "Nohlz") and are descended in the senior male line from
paraphrase: The title of Viscount Knollys, located in Caversham in Oxford County, is part of the Peerage of the United Kingdom. It was established in 1911 for Francis Knollys, who was a court official and Private Secretary to the Sovereign from 1901 to 1913. Prior to this, he was made Baron Knollys of Caversham in Oxford County in 1902. The second Viscount, who was the son of the first, served as Governor of Bermuda. The current holder of the titles is the fourth Viscount, who succeeded in 2023 and is the grandson of the second Viscount. The third Viscountess Knollys, who passed away in 2022, was the sister of Baron Farnham and served as Vice Lord-Lieutenant of Norfolk. The Viscounts Knollys are part of the notable Knollys family and are descended from the senior male line.

title: News bureau
input: A news bureau is an office for gathering or distributing news. Similar terms are used for specialized bureaus, often to indicate a geographic location or scope of coverage: a ‘Tokyo bureau’ refers to a given news operation's office in Tokyo; 'foreign bureau' is a generic term for a news office set up in a country other than the primary operations center; a ‘Washington bureau’ is an office, typically located in Washington, D.C., that covers news related to national politics in the United States. The person in charge of a news bureau is often called the bureau chief. The term is distinct from a news desk, which refers to the editorial function of assigning reporters and other staff, and otherwise coordinating, news stories, and sometimes the physical desk where
paraphrase:
news editors work.

A news bureau is a place where news is collected and distributed. Specialized bureaus may be named after a location or the type of news they cover, such as a 'Tokyo bureau' or a 'foreign bureau'. A 'Washington bureau' is an office that focuses on national politics in the United States and is usually located in Washington, D.C. The head of a news bureau is known as the bureau chief. It is important to note that a news desk is different from a news bureau, as it is responsible for assigning reporters and coordinating news stories, and may also refer to the physical desk where editors work.

title: 2014 Dzhumaya Mosque attack
input: Dzhumaya Mosque (Bulgarian: Джумая джамия) is located in Plovdiv, Plovdiv Province, Bulgaria. Its Turkish name is Hüdavendigâr Camii or Cuma Camii. The mosque is located in the centre of Plovdiv and was built in 1363–1364 on the site of the Sveta Petka Tarnovska Cathedral Church after the conquest of Plovdiv by the Ottoman army. During the reign of Sultan Murad I in the 15th century the old building was demolished and replaced by the modern-day mosque. It was called Ulu Dzhumaya Mosque, or Main Friday Mosque.The mosque is large, with nine domes and a 33 m × 27 m (108 ft × 89 ft) prayer hall. There is a minaret at the northeast corner of the main façade. Interior wall paintings date to the late 18th to early

The original building was replaced by the modern-day mosque during the reign of Sultan Murad I in the 15th century, and it was named Ulu Dzhumaya Mosque or Main Friday Mosque. The mosque is spacious, featuring nine domes and a prayer hall measuring 33 m × 27 m (108 ft × 89 ft). A minaret is located at the northeast corner of the main façade. The interior walls are adorned with Islamic motifs and calligraphy, dating back to the late 18th to early 19th century.

title: Social media newsroom
input: A social media newsroom is a company resource, set up to increase the functionality and usability of the traditional online newsroom. Social media newsrooms (SMNs) are intended to encourage dialogue and information sharing. Unlike online newsrooms, content is accessible to more than just journalists, but to all those with whom the company engages such as bloggers, their prospects, customers, business partners and investors. It gives these stakeholders access to news, public relations announcements, images, audio, video and other multimedia files. In addition to posting press releases and corporate news, companies can integrate other social content from sites such as YouTube, Flickr and Slideshow as well as streams from corporate Twitter accounts. Traditional tools for journalists such as corporate fast facts, leadership information, a multimedia library, financial information, awards
paraphrase: A social media newsroom is a resource created by companies to enhance the functionality and usability of their online newsroom. The purpose of social media newsrooms is to promote communication and information sharing. Unlike traditional online newsrooms, social media newsrooms allow access to content for a wider audience, including bloggers, customers, business partners, and investors. This platform provides stakeholders with access to news, public relations announcements, multimedia files, and other content. Companies can also integrate social content from various sites, such as YouTube, Flickr, and Slideshow, as well as streams from corporate Twitter accounts. In addition to traditional tools for journalists, such as corporate fast facts, leadership information, a multimedia library, financial information, and awards, social media newsrooms offer a more interactive and engaging experience.

title: Vienna Summer of Logic
input: The Vienna Summer of Logic was a scientific event in the summer of 2014, combining 12 major conferences and several workshops from the fields of mathematical logic, logic in computer science, and logic in artificial intelligence. The meetings took place from July 9 to 24, 2014, and attracted more than 2000 scientists and researchers.The event was organized by the Kurt Gödel Society at Vienna University of Technology. Participating meetings include:In the Logic in Computer Science stream (representing the Federated Logic Conference (FLoC)): International Conference on Computer Aided Verification (CAV) IEEE Computer Security Foundations Symposium (CSF) International Conference on Logic Programming (ICLP) International Joint Conference on Automated Reasoning (IJCAR) Conference on Interactive Theorem Proving (ITP) Joint meeting of the EACSL Annual Conference on Computer Science Logic (CSL) and the
paraphrase: Vienna Summer of Logic was a scientific gathering that occurred during the summer of 2014. It brought together 12 major conferences and various workshops from the fields of mathematical logic, logic in computer science, and logic in artificial intelligence. The event took place from July 9 to 24, 2014, and was attended by over 2000 scientists and researchers. The Kurt Gödel Society at Vienna University of Technology organized the event. The participating meetings included the International Conference on Computer Aided Verification (CAV), IEEE Computer Security Foundations Symposium (CSF), International Conference on Logic Programming (ICLP), International Joint Conference on Automated Reasoning (IJCAR), Conference on Interactive Theorem Proving (ITP), and the Joint meeting of the EACSL Annual Conference on Computer Science Logic (CSL) and the Logic in Computer Science stream (representing the Federated Logic Conference (FLoC)).

title: 2014–15 North American winter
input: The 2014–15 North American winter was frigid and prolifically wintry, especially across the eastern half of North America in the months of January–March. The season began early, with many places in North America experiencing their first wintry weather during mid-November. A period of below-average temperatures affected much of the contiguous United States, and several records were broken. An early trace of snowfall was recorded in Arkansas. There were greater accumulations of snow across parts of Oklahoma as well. A quasi-permanent phenomenon referred to as the polar vortex may have been partly responsible for the cold weather. Temperatures in much of the United States dropped 15 to 35 °F (8.3 to 19 °C) below average by November 19, following a southward "dip" of the polar vortex into the eastern
paraphrase: half of North America during the 2014-15 winter. This resulted in a frigid and snowy season, particularly in January-March, with many areas experiencing their first wintry weather in mid-November. The contiguous United States saw below-average temperatures and several records were broken, including an early trace of snowfall in Arkansas and greater snow accumulations in parts of Oklahoma. The polar vortex, a quasi-permanent phenomenon, may have contributed to the cold weather. By November 19, temperatures in much of the US had dropped 15 to 35 °F (8.3 to 19 °C) below average due to the southward dip of the polar vortex into the eastern half of North America.

title: Targeted Poverty Alleviation
input: The concept of Targeted Poverty Alleviation (simplified Chinese: 精准扶贫; traditional Chinese:精準扶貧, pinyin: jīng zhǔn fú pín) was first raised by Xi Jinping, General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party to combat poverty in China. Targeted poverty alleviation plays into China's poverty alleviation strategy, and is to contribute to the Party's century goal of “comprehensively building a “moderately prosperous society” that is the first objective of Xi Jinping’s agenda of the Four Comprehensives. In his speeches, Xi Jinping emphasizes that without solving the poverty problem in rural areas, China cannot become a moderately prosperous society.The Targeted Poverty Alleviation Strategy was officially adopted by the Chinese government in 2014. Chinese premier, Li Keqiang, said in his government report in March 2014, “local governments need to merge poverty alleviation resources….and take
paraphrase: The idea of Targeted Poverty Alleviation was introduced by Xi Jinping, the General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party, as a means to combat poverty in China. This approach is a part of China's poverty alleviation strategy and is aimed at achieving the Party's goal of building a "moderately prosperous society." Xi Jinping has emphasized the importance of addressing poverty in rural areas in order to achieve this objective. The Chinese government officially adopted the Targeted Poverty Alleviation Strategy in 2014, and Chinese premier Li Keqiang called for local governments to combine their resources to implement this strategy.

title: Arturo (polar bear)
input: Arturo (1985 – July 3, 2016) was a polar bear living in Mendoza Zoological Park in Mendoza, Argentina, the only polar bear living in the country. He was born in the United States and transferred to Argentina in 1993. His companion, a female named Pelusa, died of cancer in 2012. The living conditions of the cage Arturo resided in were controversial, as temperatures reach up to 40 °C (104 °F) in Argentina, and the pool in Arturo's cage was only 51 centimetres (20 in) deep. Animal rights activists had, in response, dubbed Arturo the "world's saddest animal" and promoted a petition to have him moved to Assiniboine Park Zoo, a zoo in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. The petition was created by Laura Morales of Hamilton, Ontario. It gained considerable
paraphrase: Arturo, who was born in the United States and lived in Mendoza Zoological Park in Argentina, was the only polar bear in the country. He lived with a female polar bear named Pelusa until she died of cancer in 2012. The conditions of Arturo's cage were controversial due to the high temperatures in Argentina and the shallow pool in his cage. Animal rights activists called him the "world's saddest animal" and started a petition to move him to Assiniboine Park Zoo in Canada. The petition gained significant attention and was created by Laura Morales from Hamilton, Ontario.

title: 2014 Jerusalem synagogue attack
input: On the morning of 18 November 2014, two Palestinian men from Jerusalem entered Kehilat Bnei Torah synagogue, in the Har Nof neighborhood of Jerusalem, and attacked the praying congregants with axes, knives, and a gun. They killed four dual-nationality worshippers, and critically wounded a responding Druze Israeli police officer, who later died of his wounds. They also injured seven male worshippers, one of whom never woke up from a coma and died 11 months later. The two attackers were then shot dead by the police. Several initial reports claimed that the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) had declared responsibility for the attack; Other sources say declarations by PFLP militants were either confused or that the group itself disclaimed responsibility. Israeli authorities stated that 'it seemed
paraphrase: that two Palestinian men from Jerusalem carried out an attack on Kehilat Bnei Torah synagogue in the Har Nof neighborhood of Jerusalem on the morning of 18 November 2014. The attackers used axes, knives, and a gun to harm the praying congregants, resulting in the death of four dual-nationality worshippers and critical injury to a responding Druze Israeli police officer who later died of his wounds. Additionally, seven male worshippers were injured, and one of them remained in a coma and died 11 months later. The police shot and killed the two attackers. While some reports initially attributed the attack to the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP), it is unclear whether the group claimed responsibility or not. Israeli authorities have stated that it appeared to be a terrorist attack.

title: 2013–14 North American winter
input: The 2013–14 North American winter was one of the most significant for the United States, due in part to the breakdown of the polar vortex in November 2013, which allowed very cold air to travel down into the United States, leading to an extended period of very cold temperatures. The pattern continued mostly uninterrupted throughout the winter and numerous significant winter storms affected the Eastern United States, with the most notable one being a powerful winter storm that dumped ice and snow in the Southeastern United States and the Northeastern United States in mid-February. Most of the cold weather abated by the end of March, though a few winter storms did affect the Western United States towards the end of the winter. While there is no well-agreed-upon date
paraphrase: The winter of 2013-14 in North America was particularly noteworthy for the United States. This was largely due to the polar vortex breaking down in November 2013, which allowed frigid air to move southward and resulted in an extended period of very cold temperatures. This weather pattern persisted throughout the winter, and the Eastern United States was hit by several significant winter storms, including a powerful one in mid-February that brought ice and snow to the Southeastern and Northeastern regions. Although the majority of the cold weather subsided by the end of March, a few winter storms did affect the Western United States towards the end of the season. While there is no universally agreed-upon date, this winter season was considered to be a significant one.

title: 16th Asian Film Awards
input: The 16th Asian Film Awards was held on March 12, 2023 at Hong Kong Jockey Club Auditorium in Hong Kong Palace Museum. The nominations were announced on January 6, 2023. At the 16th edition of the awards ceremony, 30 films from 22 regions and countries were shortlisted for 81 nominations. South Korean film Decision to Leave received 10 nominations most for any film whereas Drive My Car with eight nominations was second.Lin Min Chen, a Malaysian Chinese singer, actor and model was appointed as Youth Ambassador of the film awards.The award ceremony hosted by Grace Chan and Sammy Leung was held on 12 March 2023, where international actors and celebrities from Hong Kong walked the red carpet. Hiroshi Abe, Japanese model and actor, was presented with Excellence in
paraphrase: On March 12, 2023, the 16th Asian Film Awards took place at the Hong Kong Jockey Club Auditorium in the Hong Kong Palace Museum. The nominations were revealed on January 6, 2023, with 30 films from 22 regions and countries being shortlisted for a total of 81 nominations. The South Korean film, Decision to Leave, received the most nominations with 10, followed by Drive My Car with eight. Lin Min Chen, a Malaysian Chinese singer, actor, and model, was appointed as the Youth Ambassador for the awards. The ceremony was hosted by Grace Chan and Sammy Leung, and international actors and celebrities from Hong Kong graced the red carpet. Hiroshi Abe, a Japanese model and actor, was awarded the Excellence in category.

title: Trojan Horse scandal
input: The Trojan Horse scandal, also known as "Operation Trojan Horse" or the Trojan Horse affair, involves claims of an alleged conspiracy to introduce an "Islamist" or "Salafist" ethos into several schools in Birmingham, England. The name, based on the Greek legend, comes from an anonymous letter sent to Birmingham City Council in late 2013, alleged to be from Birmingham "Islamists" detailing how to wrest control of a school, and speculating about expanding the scheme to other cities. The letter was leaked to the press in March 2014. Around a month later, Birmingham City Council revealed that following the letter release it had received hundreds of allegations of plots similar to those described in the letter, some claims dating back over 20 years.Tahir Alam, former chairman of the Park
paraphrase: The scandal known as the Trojan Horse affair, also referred to as "Operation Trojan Horse," involves accusations of a supposed plot to introduce an "Islamist" or "Salafist" ideology into multiple schools in Birmingham, England. The name is derived from a letter sent anonymously to Birmingham City Council in late 2013, purportedly from Birmingham "Islamists," outlining a plan to take control of a school and potentially expand the scheme to other cities. The letter was made public in March 2014, and shortly after, Birmingham City Council disclosed that it had received numerous allegations of similar plots dating back over two decades. Tahir Alam, the former chairman of the Park School, was implicated in the scandal.

title: Death of Atsumi Yoshikubo
input: Around midday on October 22, 2014, a passing motorist saw an Asian woman walking north along the Ingraham Trail on the outskirts of Yellowknife in the Northwest Territories, Canada. Several days later, after seeing stories in the local media that 45-year old Atsumi Yoshikubo (吉窪昌美) who had been visiting the city from her home in southern Japan, had gone missing, she reported the sighting. It was the last time she was seen alive. Yoshikubo's absence was first noted five days after that sighting, when staff at her hotel noticed she had not checked out two days after her stay was due to have ended. In her room they found her luggage, still packed; she had apparently never boarded her flight home. Footage from the hotel's security camera showed
paraphrase: On October 22, 2014, a woman of Asian descent was spotted walking north along the Ingraham Trail on the outskirts of Yellowknife in the Northwest Territories, Canada, by a passing motorist around midday. The woman was later identified as Atsumi Yoshikubo, a 45-year-old visitor from southern Japan who had gone missing. The witness reported the sighting after seeing news stories about Yoshikubo's disappearance several days later. Unfortunately, this was the last time Yoshikubo was seen alive. Her absence was first noticed by hotel staff five days after the sighting when she failed to check out two days after her stay was supposed to end. Her luggage was found packed in her room, and it appeared that she never boarded her flight home. The hotel's security camera footage showed this.

title: 2023 DFB-Pokal final
input: The 2023 DFB-Pokal Final will decide the winner of the 2022–23 DFB-Pokal, the 80th season of the annual German football cup competition. The match will be played on 3 June 2023 at the Olympiastadion in Berlin.The winner will host the 2023 edition of the DFL-Supercup at the start of the following season, and will face the champion of the 2022–23 edition of the Bundesliga, unless the same team wins the Bundesliga and the DFB-Pokal, completing a double. In that case, the runner-up of the Bundesliga will take the spot and host instead. The winner of the DFB-Pokal also earns automatic qualification for the group stage of the 2023–24 edition of the UEFA Europa League. However, if the winner has already qualified for the 2023–24 edition of the UEFA

The victor of this match will host the 2023 DFL-Supercup at the beginning of the next season and will face the champion of the 2022-23 edition of the Bundesliga, unless the same team wins both competitions, in which case the runner-up of the Bundesliga will take their place. The winner of the DFB-Pokal will also automatically qualify for the group stage of the 2023-24 UEFA Europa League, unless they have already qualified for the tournament.

title: Puteri Indonesia 2023
input: Puteri Indonesia 2023, (Lampungnese: , Javanese: ꦦꦸꦠꦺꦫꦶ​ꦆꦤ꧀ꦢꦺꦴꦤꦺꦱ​꧇꧒꧐꧒꧓꧇) the 26th Puteri Indonesia pageant, will be held on 19 May 2023 in Jakarta, Indonesia. Puteri Indonesia 2022, Laksmi Shari De-Neefe Suardana of Bali will crown her successor at the end of the event. From this edition, Puteri Indonesia lost the rights to select and send the Indonesian representative to the Miss Universe competition. Puteri Indonesia 2023 will represent Indonesia at Miss International 2023. Puteri Indonesia Lingkungan 2022 and Puteri Indonesia Pariwisata 2022, Cindy May McGuire of Jakarta SCR 5 and Adinda Cresheilla of East Java will also crown their successors. Puteri Indonesia Pariwisata 2023 will represent Indonesia at Miss Supranational 2023 and Puteri Indonesia Lingkungan 2023 will represent Indonesia at Miss Charm 2024. For the sixth time since the 1994
paraphrase: The 26th Puteri Indonesia pageant, known as Puteri Indonesia 2023, is scheduled to take place on May 19, 2023 in Jakarta, Indonesia. The current titleholder, Laksmi Shari De-Neefe Suardana of Bali, will pass on her crown to the winner of the event. However, starting from this edition, Puteri Indonesia will no longer have the authority to choose and send the Indonesian representative to the Miss Universe competition. Instead, the winner of Puteri Indonesia 2023 will represent Indonesia at Miss International 2023. Additionally, the current titleholders of Puteri Indonesia Lingkungan 2022 and Puteri Indonesia Pariwisata 2022, Cindy May McGuire of Jakarta SCR 5 and Adinda Cresheilla of East Java, respectively, will also crown their successors. The winner of Puteri Indonesia Pariwisata 2023 will represent Indonesia at Miss Supranational 2023, while the winner of Puteri Indonesia Lingkungan 2023 will represent Indonesia at Miss Charm 2024. This will be the sixth time since 1994 that the pageant will be held.

title: 2023 Las Anod conflict
input: The 2023 Las Anod conflict is an ongoing armed conflict between the Somaliland National Army and militias of the Dhulbahante, Majeerteen and Warsangali clans that ensued in Las Anod, the capital of the Sool region. Fighting erupted on February 6 after Somaliland security forces held a violent crackdown on civil protests. On February 8, the supreme Garad of Dhulbahante, Garad Jama Garad Ali, declared an intent to secede and reunite with the Federal Government of Somalia.The conflict has killed over 300 people and displaced 153,000-203,000 refugees, either externally to Buuhodle and the Ethiopian border or internally to SSC-Khatumo Forces controlled districts like Taleex, Xudun, Buuhodle etc. and Garowe, Galkacyo, Burtinle and other cities in Puntland. On March 16, Somaliland troops were reported to be shelling civilians from the
paraphrase: The ongoing armed conflict in Las Anod, which began in 2023, involves the Somaliland National Army and militias from the Dhulbahante, Majeerteen, and Warsangali clans. The conflict started on February 6 when Somaliland security forces violently suppressed civil protests, leading to fighting. On February 8, the supreme Garad of Dhulbahante, Garad Jama Garad Ali, announced a desire to secede and reunite with the Federal Government of Somalia. The conflict has resulted in the deaths of more than 300 people and the displacement of 153,000-203,000 refugees, both internally and externally. Some have fled to areas controlled by the SSC-Khatumo Forces, such as Taleex, Xudun, and Buuhodle, while others have sought refuge in cities like Garowe, Galkacyo, Burtinle, and along the Ethiopian border. On March 16, reports emerged that Somaliland troops were targeting civilians with shelling.

title: 2014 Thai surrogacy controversy
input: In July 2014, an internationally publicised incident occurred in which a Thai woman, Pattaramon Janbua, who had been hired as a surrogate mother for an Australian couple, sought to raise money for her critically ill surrogate son. The baby had been in her care since she gave birth in December 2013; biological parents David John Farnell and Wenyu Wendy Li had left Thailand 2 months later with baby Gammy's twin sister Pipah.When ultrasound results seven months into the surrogate pregnancy indicated that Ms Pattaramon was carrying twins and that one of the twins, a boy, had Down syndrome, Farnell and Li requested that she abort him, and that they would keep only the child's twin sister. Ms Pattaramon refused, citing her Buddhist beliefs, and instead opted to raise
paraphrase: In July 2014, a widely publicized event took place involving Pattaramon Janbua, a Thai woman who had been hired as a surrogate mother for an Australian couple. She attempted to raise funds for her critically ill surrogate son, whom she had been caring for since his birth in December 2013. The biological parents, David John Farnell and Wenyu Wendy Li, had left Thailand with the baby's twin sister, Pipah, two months later. When an ultrasound revealed that Pattaramon was carrying twins and that one of them, a boy, had Down syndrome, Farnell and Li asked her to terminate the pregnancy and keep only the twin sister. However, Pattaramon, who is a Buddhist, refused and decided to raise the child herself.

title: 2014 Moscow City Duma election
input: Election to the 6th convocation of the Moscow City Duma took place on the United Voting Day on September 14, 2014. The elections were held in full by the majority system, 45 deputies were elected in 45 single-member constituencies (previously there were 35 deputies in the Duma) out of 258 candidates. The term of the new Duma will be five years. The elections were held on September 14 on more than 3,500 ballots in the city. The final results were announced on September 16, 2014.17 deputies from the previous City Duma retained their seats. After processing 100% of the ballots, the leaders of the vote were: 28 people nominated by the United Russia party, 5 by the Communist Party, 1 by the LDPR, 1 by Rodina, and 10
paraphrase: The 6th convocation of the Moscow City Duma was elected on September 14, 2014, which was the United Voting Day. The majority system was used, and 45 deputies were elected in 45 single-member constituencies, with a total of 258 candidates. The previous Duma had 35 deputies. The new Duma will serve for five years. The elections were held on over 3,500 ballots in the city, and the final results were announced on September 16, 2014. 17 deputies from the previous City Duma were re-elected. After counting all the ballots, the United Russia party had 28 nominees elected, followed by 5 from the Communist Party, 1 from the LDPR, 1 from Rodina, and 10 independents.

title: FATCA agreement between Canada and the United States
input: The FATCA agreement is an international agreement signed between Canada and the United States that allows the implementation of the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (an Act of the U.S. Congress) in Canada. It is one of 30 intergovernmental agreements the US has concluded with other countries to implement the FATCA.FATCA requires United States persons, including individuals who live outside the United States, and financial institutions outside the United States, to report the principal amount held in their financial accounts outside of the United States to the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). According to the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC) there are about one million American citizens living in Canada. This treaty also affects their spouses, children, or anyone with whom they own property, share a business connection, or hold
paraphrase: The FATCA agreement is a pact between Canada and the United States that enables the implementation of the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act, which is a law passed by the U.S. Congress, in Canada. This agreement is one of 30 such agreements that the U.S. has made with other countries to enforce the FATCA. The FATCA requires individuals who are U.S. citizens, even if they reside outside the U.S., and foreign financial institutions to disclose the primary amount held in their financial accounts outside the U.S. to the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). The CBC reports that approximately one million American citizens live in Canada, and this treaty also affects their partners, children, or anyone with whom they have property ownership, business ties, or financial holdings.

title: Jewish Museum of Belgium shooting
input: On the afternoon of 24 May 2014, a gunman opened fire at the Jewish Museum of Belgium in Brussels, killing four people. Three of them, an Israeli couple on holiday and a French woman, died at the scene. The fourth victim, a Belgian employee of the museum, was taken to the hospital but died of his injuries on 6 June. A little less than a week later, on 30 May 2014, a suspect was arrested in the French city of Marseille in connection with the shooting. The suspect was Mehdi Nemmouche, a 29-year-old French national of Algerian origin. A second suspect, Nacer Bendrer, was identified and arrested later. Prior to the shooting, Nemmouche had already spent time in French prisons, where he became involved in radical Islam. After
paraphrase: In May 2014, a gunman attacked the Jewish Museum of Belgium in Brussels, resulting in the deaths of four individuals. Among the victims were an Israeli couple on vacation, a French woman, and a Belgian museum employee who passed away from injuries sustained in the attack. A suspect, Mehdi Nemmouche, was apprehended in Marseille, France on May 30th, and later, a second suspect, Nacer Bendrer, was also arrested. Prior to the shooting, Nemmouche had served time in French prisons and had become involved in radical Islam.

title: Impact of the Arab Spring
input: The impact of the Arab Spring concerns protests or by the way attempts to organize growing protest movements that were inspired by or similar to the Arab Spring in the Arab-majority states of North Africa and the Middle East, according to commentators, organisers, and critics. These demonstrations and protest efforts have all been critical of the government in their respective countries, though they have ranged from calls for the incumbent government to make certain policy changes to attempts to bring down the current political system in its entirety. In some countries, protests have become large or widespread enough to effect change at the national level, as in Armenia, while in others, such as Djibouti, were swiftly suppressed.Protests considered to be inspired by the Arab Spring have taken place
paraphrase: in Arab-majority states of North Africa and the Middle East, and have been the subject of discussion among commentators, organizers, and critics. These protests have been aimed at criticizing the government in their respective countries, with some calling for specific policy changes and others seeking to overthrow the entire political system. In some cases, these protests have led to significant national-level changes, as seen in Armenia, while in other cases, such as Djibouti, they were quickly suppressed.

title: 2023 Estonian parliamentary election
input: Parliamentary elections were held in Estonia on 5 March 2023 to elect all 101 members of the Riigikogu. The officially published election data indicate the victory of the Reform Party, which won 37 seats in total, while the Conservative People's Party of Estonia (EKRE) placed second with 17 seats. The Centre Party won 16 seats, a loss of 10, while Estonia 200 won 14 seats, gaining representation in Riigikogu. After the previous parliamentary election in 2019, the Centre Party, led by Jüri Ratas, formed a government with Ratas serving as prime minister. His government was brought down in January 2021 after a corruption investigation, and Kaja Kallas of the Reform Party formed a coalition government with the Centre Party; which collapsed in June 2022. Kallas then formed a
paraphrase: Parliamentary elections were conducted in Estonia on March 5, 2023, to select all 101 members of the Riigikogu. The official election results reveal that the Reform Party emerged victorious, securing 37 seats in total, while the Conservative People's Party of Estonia (EKRE) came in second with 17 seats. The Centre Party won 16 seats, experiencing a loss of 10, while Estonia 200 won 14 seats, gaining representation in the Riigikogu. Following the previous parliamentary election in 2019, Jüri Ratas, the leader of the Centre Party, formed a government and served as prime minister. However, his government was toppled in January 2021 due to a corruption investigation, and Kaja Kallas of the Reform Party formed a coalition government with the Centre Party, which collapsed in June 2022. Kallas then established a new government.

title: 2014–15 Croatian presidential election
input: Presidential elections were held in Croatia on 28 December 2014 and 11 January 2015, the sixth such elections since independence in 1991. Only four candidates contested the elections, the lowest number since 1997. Incumbent President Ivo Josipović, who had been elected as the candidate of the Social Democratic Party in 2009–2010 but ran as an independent, was eligible to seek reelection for a second and final five-year term. As no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round in December 2014, a run-off took place in January 2015 between the two candidates with the most votes; Josipović and Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović. Grabar-Kitarović went on to win the elections by a slim margin of 32,509 votes or 1.48%, making her Croatia's first female president.The elections were the second
paraphrase: Presidential elections were held in Croatia in December 2014 and January 2015, marking the sixth such elections since the country gained independence in 1991. The number of candidates was the lowest since 1997, with only four individuals running for office. The incumbent President, Ivo Josipović, who had previously been elected as the candidate of the Social Democratic Party in 2009-2010, ran as an independent and was eligible to seek re-election for a second and final five-year term. Since no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round in December 2014, a run-off was held in January 2015 between the two candidates with the most votes, Josipović and Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović. Grabar-Kitarović won the election by a narrow margin of 32,509 votes or 1.48%, becoming Croatia's first female president. These elections were the second to be held under the country's amended constitution, which reduced the presidential term from five to four years.

title: 2014–2015 African cholera outbreak
input: Declared in June 2014, the West and Central African cholera outbreak as of January 25, 2015 claimed 1,683 registered deaths and over 91,361 reported cases with a reported case fatality rate (CFR) of 2% in 11 countries, which is 3 times more than in 2013. The case fatality ratio is high in the Sahelian area, equal or greater than 2%, especially in Nigeria, Chad, Cameroon and Niger. Nigeria, Ghana and Democratic Republic of the Congo being the most affected countries with Ghana reporting its worst outbreak since 1982.In January 2015 the Greater Accra Region and Volta region still reported cases of Cholera while in the rest of Ghana the outbreak was declared over. As of January 11 the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Ghana and Nigeria are the
paraphrase: As of January 25, 2015, the West and Central African cholera outbreak, which was announced in June 2014, had resulted in over 91,361 reported cases and 1,683 registered deaths across 11 countries. The reported case fatality rate (CFR) was 2%, which is three times higher than in 2013. The Sahelian area had the highest case fatality ratio, with Nigeria, Chad, Cameroon, and Niger being the most affected countries. Ghana reported its worst outbreak since 1982, with Nigeria, Ghana, and the Democratic Republic of the Congo being the most affected countries. As of January 11, the outbreak was declared over in most of Ghana, but the Greater Accra Region and Volta region still reported cases of cholera.

title: 2013–2014 chikungunya outbreak
input: The 2013–2014 chikungunya outbreak represented the first recorded outbreak of the disease outside of tropical Africa and Asia. In December 2013, the first locally transmitted case of chikungunya in the Americas was detected in Saint Martin. Shortly after the first case the disease began to spread rapidly throughout the Caribbean region. By the end of the year, it had spread to Martinique and Guadeloupe, with suspected cases in Saint Barthélemy. By the end of January 2014, cases had been confirmed in Saint Barthélemy, as well as the British Virgin Islands, Dominica, and French Guiana. On the basis of 4,000 confirmed cases and over 30,000 suspected cases, the Caribbean Public Health Agency (CARPHA) declared a Caribbean-wide epidemic of the virus in early May. By January 2014, cases had been confirmed in several other locations. The Caribbean Public Health Agency declared an epidemic in early May based on thousands of confirmed and suspected cases. title: Media monitoring service
input: A media monitoring service, a press clipping service or a clipping service as known in earlier times, provides clients with copies of media content, which is of specific interest to them and subject to changing demand; what they provide may include documentation, content, analysis, or editorial opinion, specifically or widely. These services tend to specialize their coverage by subject, industry, size, geography, publication, journalist, or editor. The printed sources, which could be readily monitored, greatly expanded with the advent of telegraphy and submarine cables in the mid- to late-19th century; the various types of media now available proliferated in the 20th century, with the development of radio, television, the photocopier and the World Wide Web. Though media monitoring is generally used for capturing content or editorial opinion, it
paraphrase: refers to a service that provides clients with copies of media content that is of interest to them and subject to changing demand. This may include documentation, content, analysis, or editorial opinion, and can be specialized by subject, industry, size, geography, publication, journalist, or editor. The expansion of printed sources in the mid- to late-19th century and the development of various types of media in the 20th century greatly increased the availability of content. While media monitoring is typically used to capture content or editorial opinion, it can encompass a wide range of media.

title: Post-coup unrest in Egypt (2013–2014)
input: Protests against the 2013 Egyptian coup d'état erupted in July 2013. Immediately following the removal of President Mohamed Morsi by the Egyptian Armed Forces on 3 July 2013 amid demonstrations against Morsi's rule, many protesters amassed near the Rabia Al-Adawiya Mosque to call for Morsi's return to power and condemn the military, while others demonstrated in support of the military and interim government. Deadly clashes such as Rabaa massacre continued for several days, with three particularly bloody incidents being described by officials as "massacres" perpetrated by security forces. During the month of Ramadan (10 July – 7 August), prime minister Hazem al-Beblawy threatened to disperse the ongoing Pro-Morsi sit-ins in Rabaa al-Adaweya square and al-Nahda square. The government crackdown of these protests occurred in a violent dispersal on
paraphrase: In July 2013, protests erupted in opposition to the 2013 Egyptian coup d'état. This was triggered by the removal of President Mohamed Morsi by the Egyptian Armed Forces on 3 July 2013, which led to demonstrations against Morsi's rule. Many protesters gathered near the Rabia Al-Adawiya Mosque to demand Morsi's reinstatement and condemn the military, while others supported the military and interim government. The protests resulted in violent clashes, including the Rabaa massacre, which officials described as "massacres" committed by security forces. In August, the prime minister threatened to disperse the ongoing Pro-Morsi sit-ins in Rabaa al-Adaweya square and al-Nahda square, which eventually led to a violent crackdown by the government.

title: 67th British Academy Film Awards
input: The 67th British Academy Film Awards, more commonly known as the BAFTAs, were held on 16 February 2014 at the Royal Opera House in London, honouring the best national and foreign films of 2013. The nominations were announced on 8 January 2014 by actor Luke Evans and actress Helen McCrory. Presented by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts, accolades were handed out for the best feature-length film and documentaries of any nationality that were screened at British cinemas in 2013.Gravity won six of its eleven nominations, including Best Director for Alfonso Cuarón, Outstanding British Film, Best Cinematography, Best Original Music, Best Sound, and Best Special Visual Effects. 12 Years a Slave won Best Film and Best Actor in a Leading Role for Chiwetel Ejiofor. Cate Blanchett
paraphrase: The BAFTAs, also known as the 67th British Academy Film Awards, took place on February 16, 2014 at the Royal Opera House in London. The event recognized the top national and foreign films of 2013. The nominations were revealed on January 8, 2014 by actors Luke Evans and Helen McCrory. The British Academy of Film and Television Arts presented awards for the best feature-length films and documentaries from any country that were shown in British cinemas in 2013. Gravity received six out of eleven nominations, including Best Director for Alfonso Cuarón, Outstanding British Film, Best Cinematography, Best Original Music, Best Sound, and Best Special Visual Effects. 12 Years a Slave won Best Film and Best Actor in a Leading Role for Chiwetel Ejiofor. Cate Blanchett was also recognized for her achievements.

title: 40th G7 summit
input: The 40th G7 summit was held 4–5 June, 2014 in Brussels, Belgium. It was originally scheduled to be held as the “40th G8 summit” and be hosted by Russia in the Black Sea resort of Sochi. However, the other seven countries decided on 24 March that the summit would be instead held without Russia in Brussels.Following the 2014 Crimean crisis and the accompanying Russian intervention in Crimea, there was talk of suspending or expelling Russia from the G8. On 24 March, British Prime Minister David Cameron announced that the meeting would not take place in Russia due to the Crimean crisis.The G8 is an unofficial forum which brings together the heads of major world powers: Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Italy, Japan, the United States, Canada (all since
paraphrase: The 40th G7 summit took place on June 4-5, 2014 in Brussels, Belgium. Originally, it was planned to be the 40th G8 summit hosted by Russia in Sochi. However, due to the Crimean crisis and Russian intervention in Crimea, the other seven countries decided on March 24 to hold the summit without Russia in Brussels. There were discussions about suspending or expelling Russia from the G8, and British Prime Minister David Cameron announced on March 24 that the meeting would not take place in Russia. The G8 is an informal gathering of major world powers, including Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Italy, Japan, the United States, and Canada (all members since).

title: 2023 International Conference on Climate Resilient Pakistan
input: 2023 International Conference on Climate Resilient Pakistan, more commonly referred to as 2023 Geneva conference, was a one-day international conference on aid to Pakistani Government after the devastating floods in 2022. The conference was co-hosted by the Pakistani Government and the United Nations, held on 9 January 2023 in Geneva, Switzerland. Shehbaz Sharif, the Prime Minister of Pakistan, and Antonio Guterres, the Secretary-General of the United Nations, began the one-day conference, the more than 450 attendees including private donors, international financial organizations, and government representatives from around 40 countries.In the conference, Pakistan presented the “Resilient, Recovery, Rehabilitation, and Reconstruction Framework” (4RF) and seek international support and long-term partnerships for its implementation. The 4RF document covers the funding mechanism and institutional arrangements for its execution in an open, transparent,
paraphrase: and accountable manner. The 2023 Geneva conference, also known as the 2023 International Conference on Climate Resilient Pakistan, was a global event held on January 9, 2023, in Geneva, Switzerland. The conference aimed to provide aid to the Pakistani Government after the devastating floods that occurred in 2022. Co-hosted by the Pakistani Government and the United Nations, the conference was attended by over 450 individuals, including private donors, government representatives from around 40 countries, and international financial organizations. The conference began with speeches from Shehbaz Sharif, the Prime Minister of Pakistan, and Antonio Guterres, the Secretary-General of the United Nations. During the conference, Pakistan presented the "Resilient, Recovery, Rehabilitation, and Reconstruction Framework" (4RF) and sought international support and long-term partnerships for its implementation. The 4RF document outlines the funding mechanism and institutional arrangements for its execution in an open, transparent, and accountable manner.

title: Triplemanía XXXI
input: Triplemanía XXXI is an ongoing three-day professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event promoted and produced by the Mexican professional wrestling promotion Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide (AAA or Triple A). The event is being held on April 16, July 15, and August 12, 2023. The April 16 event took place at Estadio de Béisbol Monterrey in Monterrey, the July 15 event will take place at Estadio Chevron in Tijuana and the August 12 event at Arena Ciudad de México in Mexico City. It marks the 31st year in a row that AAA will hold a Triplemanía show and comprises the 40th, 41st, and 42nd overall shows held under the Triplemanía banner since 1993. The annual Triplemanía show is AAA's biggest event of the year, serving as the culmination of major
paraphrase: Triplemanía XXXI is a professional wrestling pay-per-view event organized and promoted by Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide (AAA or Triple A), which is currently taking place over three days. The event is scheduled for April 16, July 15, and August 12, 2023, with the April 16 event held at Estadio de Béisbol Monterrey in Monterrey, the July 15 event at Estadio Chevron in Tijuana, and the August 12 event at Arena Ciudad de México in Mexico City. This marks the 31st consecutive year that AAA has hosted a Triplemanía show, and it includes the 40th, 41st, and 42nd overall shows held under the Triplemanía banner since 1993. The annual Triplemanía show is AAA's most significant event of the year, serving as the culmination of major wrestling storylines.

title: 7th Crunchyroll Anime Awards
input: The 7th Crunchyroll Anime Awards was held on March 4, 2023, at the Main Banquet Hall of the Grand Prince Hotel New Takanawa in Tokyo, Japan. It was the first ceremony to be held in person since 2020; both ceremonies in 2021 and 2022 were held virtually. Additionally, it was the first ceremony to be held in Japan, as previous physical ceremonies were held in the United States. Anime released on television or online in Japan from November 2021 to September 2022 were eligible for nominations for this edition. The ceremony was hosted by voice actress Sally Amaki and presenter Jon Kabira, with Sony CEO Kenichiro Yoshida opening the show. Previous winners ALI and AKLO, Yuki Kajiura, and Kohta Yamamoto performed at the ceremony, while singer Haruka Kaki

This was the first time the ceremony was held in person since 2020, as the 2021 and 2022 ceremonies were held virtually. It was also the first time the ceremony was held in Japan, as previous physical ceremonies were held in the United States. The awards were open to anime released on television or online in Japan from November 2021 to September 2022. The ceremony was hosted by Sally Amaki and Jon Kabira, with Kenichiro Yoshida, the CEO of Sony, opening the show. ALI and AKLO, Yuki Kajiura, and Kohta Yamamoto, who were previous winners, performed at the ceremony, while Haruka Kaki also sang.

title: 2022–2023 Pakistani economic crisis
input: The 2022-2023 Pakistan economic crisis is an ongoing economic crisis and part of 2022-2023 political unrest in Pakistan. It has caused severe economic challenges for months due to which food, gas and oil prices have risen. The Russian invasion of Ukraine has caused fuel prices to rise worldwide. Excessive external borrowings by the country over the years raised the spectre of default, causing the currency to fall and making imports more expensive in relative terms. By June 2022, inflation was at an all time high, along with rising food prices.Poor governance and low productivity per capita in comparison with other low to middle-income developing countries have contributed to a balance of payment crisis, where the country is unable to earn enough foreign exchange to fund the imports that
paraphrase:
are necessary for its economy.

The ongoing economic crisis in Pakistan, which is part of the political unrest in the country, has resulted in significant economic challenges for several months. This has led to a rise in food, gas, and oil prices, which has been exacerbated by the global increase in fuel prices due to the Russian invasion of Ukraine. The country's excessive external borrowing over the years has raised concerns about default, causing the currency to depreciate and making imports more expensive. Inflation reached an all-time high by June 2022, accompanied by a rise in food prices. Poor governance and low productivity per capita compared to other low to middle-income developing countries have contributed to a balance of payment crisis, where the country is unable to generate enough foreign exchange to finance its necessary imports.

title: 2014 Berlin Marathon
input: The 2014 Berlin Marathon was the 41st edition of the Berlin Marathon. The marathon took place in Berlin, Germany, on 28 September 2014 and was the fourth World Marathon Majors race of the year. The men's race was won by Kenyan athlete Dennis Kimetto in a world record time of 2:02:57, breaking the previous record of Wilson Kipsang by 26 seconds. Kimetto's performance means that the last six men's world records at the distance have all been set at the Berlin Marathon. Runner-up Emmanuel Mutai also surpassed Kipsang's old mark, finishing in 2:03:13. En route to his second-place finish, Mutai set a world record at the 30K distance (1:27:37).The women's race was won by Tirfi Tsegaye of Ethiopia in a time of 2:20:18 hours. Finishing third in a
paraphrase: The 41st Berlin Marathon was held on 28 September 2014 in Berlin, Germany and was the fourth World Marathon Majors race of the year. Kenyan athlete Dennis Kimetto won the men's race, breaking the previous world record set by Wilson Kipsang by 26 seconds with a time of 2:02:57. This means that the last six men's world records at the distance have been set at the Berlin Marathon. Emmanuel Mutai finished second and also surpassed Kipsang's old record with a time of 2:03:13. Mutai also set a world record at the 30K distance with a time of 1:27:37. The women's race was won by Tirfi Tsegaye of Ethiopia with a time of 2:20:18, while the third-place finisher in the men's race is not mentioned.

title: 2014 Belgian government formation
input: Following the simultaneous federal elections and regional elections of 25 May 2014, negotiations started to form a new Federal Government as well as new regional governments: a Flemish, Walloon, French Community and Brussels Government. A Government of the German-speaking Community was formed only a few days after the elections. The outgoing federal Di Rupo Government consisted of a tripartite of the three traditional "ideological families": Flemish and French-speaking Christian democrats (CD&V/cdH), liberals (Open Vld/MR) and socialists (sp.a/PS). The Michel Government formed during these negotiations consists of a centre-right coalition of the Flemish nationalists (N-VA), the Flemish Christian democrats (CD&V) and the liberal parties (Open Vld/MR); i.e. only one party at French-speaking side. The new Flemish Government reflects the same coalition, whereas the Walloon and French Community Governments are
paraphrase: After the federal and regional elections on May 25, 2014, discussions began to establish new governments at both the federal and regional levels, including a Flemish, Walloon, French Community, Brussels, and German-speaking Community government. The previous federal Di Rupo Government was made up of a tripartite coalition of Flemish and French-speaking Christian democrats, liberals, and socialists. The new Michel Government, formed during these negotiations, is a center-right coalition consisting of Flemish nationalists, Christian democrats, and liberal parties, with only one party representing the French-speaking side. The new Flemish Government is also made up of this coalition, while the Walloon and French Community Governments are not specified.

title: Blockade of the Gaza Strip
input: The blockade of the Gaza Strip is the ongoing land, air, and sea blockade of the Gaza Strip imposed by Israel and Egypt temporarily in 2005–2006 and permanently from 2007 onwards, following the Israeli disengagement from Gaza.The blockade was made permanent after Hamas took control of the Gaza Strip during the Battle of Gaza, seizing government institutions and replacing Fatah and other Palestinian Authority (PA) officials with Hamas members. Earlier, after Hamas won elections and formed the PA government in March 2006, led by Ismail Haniya, Israel and the Quartet on the Middle East set conditions before they would continue to provide aid to the PA or have any dialogue with any member of a Hamas-led PA government. These conditions were: recognition of Israel, disavowal of violent actions,
paraphrase: Israel and Egypt have imposed a blockade on the Gaza Strip since 2005-2006, which became permanent in 2007 after Hamas took control of the area during the Battle of Gaza. This resulted in the replacement of Fatah and other Palestinian Authority officials with Hamas members. Prior to this, when Hamas won elections and formed the PA government in March 2006, Israel and the Quartet on the Middle East set conditions for aid and dialogue, including recognition of Israel and disavowal of violent actions.

title: The Reddings
input: The Reddings was an American funk, soul and disco band, founded by Otis Redding's sons Dexter (bass and vocals) and Otis Redding III (December 17, 1963 – April 18, 2023 age 59; guitar) together with Mark Lockett (drums, keyboards, and lead vocal).Their most well-known songs include "Remote Control" (1980) / "Doin' it" / "Funkin on the One" / "Class (Is What You Got)" (1981) / "Sittin' on the Dock of the Bay" (1982) / "Hand Dance" (1983) and "The Awakening" (1980), a bass-drums-duet which is often performed live by Les Claypool (Primus) and on his album Highball with the Devil. Their album The Reddings was released on November 26, 1988, and reached a peak position of #88 on the US Billboard album chart. It featured a hit single
paraphrase: The Reddings, a band that played funk, soul, and disco music, was formed by Dexter and Otis Redding III, the sons of Otis Redding, along with Mark Lockett, who played drums, keyboards, and sang lead vocals. Some of their popular songs include "Remote Control," "Doin' it," "Funkin on the One," "Class (Is What You Got)," "Sittin' on the Dock of the Bay," "Hand Dance," and "The Awakening," which is a bass and drums duet that is often performed live by Les Claypool of Primus. Their self-titled album was released on November 26, 1988, and reached #88 on the US Billboard album chart. It also featured a hit single.

title: 2023 Chinese military exercises around Taiwan
input: The 2023 Chinese military exercises around Taiwan (simplified Chinese: 2023年环台军事演练; traditional Chinese: 2023年環台軍事演練) are a series of ongoing military exercises by the People's Liberation Army (PLA) of the People's Republic of China (PRC) encircling Taiwan (the Republic of China, ROC). On 8 April 2023, the PLA announced the start of "combat readiness patrols" and dispatched dozens of fighter jets and several warships toward Taiwan. The exercises occurred in response to Taiwanese president Tsai Ing-wen's visit to US Speaker of the House Kevin McCarthy.On 4 March 2023, McCarthy announced he had planned a meeting with president Tsai, which was scheduled for early April. In response, the PLA made multiple threats toward the Taiwanese government. Tsai arrived in the U.S. on 4 April and met with prominent lawmakers, including McCarthy.

On 8 April 2023, the PLA announced the start of "combat readiness patrols" and sent fighter jets and warships towards Taiwan. These exercises were initiated in response to Taiwanese president Tsai Ing-wen's visit to US Speaker of the House Kevin McCarthy. McCarthy had planned a meeting with Tsai in early April, which led to multiple threats from the PLA towards the Taiwanese government. Tsai arrived in the U.S. on 4 April and met with prominent lawmakers, including McCarthy.
